loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a 30-year-old mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Rosa has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine, to support her  business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Rosa hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Zhiparhan

texts.ru: Жипархан, 55 лет, вдова, 2 сыновей. Образование-среднее, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Сыновья Жипархан помогают ей по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, на 1,0 Га земли она выращивает рис. Ежемесячный доход Жипархан составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, так как сельское хозяйство это единственный источник дохода ее семьи, Жипархан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Жипархан является лидером группы "Жоогазын", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита Жипархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Zhiparhan is 55 years old and is a widow with two sons. She has a secondary education. She has been engaged in agriculture - animal rearing and crop growing - for many years. Zhiparhan's sons help her on the farmstead. Today her farmstead has three cows and she grows rice on 1.0 hectares of land. Zhiparhan's monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS), insufficient funds for a decent life. As agriculture is the only source of income for her family, Zhiparhan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.

Zhiparhan is the leader of the "Zhoogazyn" group in which besides her are another three people, totalling four. Zhiparhan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Voary Narindra Faniry Domoina

texts.fr:
Voary Narindra est une mère célibataire. elle a un enfant qui est en pré-scolaire. Le père de son enfant l'a quitté dès qu'elle était enceinte donc il n'a pas reconnu l'enfant. Elle assume seule les responsabilités parentales. Elle a 23 ans.A cause de sa situation, elle et son petit habitent avec sa mère pour le moment.
L'achat et revente des poissons séchées constitue son activité, source de revenu. C'est une activité qu'elle a appris de sa mère il y a 4 ans.
Son rêve le plus cher est d'avoir son autonomie et son indépendance, vivre seule avec son enfant, avoir son propre foyer(sa maison). C'est une jeune femme battante, combative et travailleuse.
texts.en:
Voary Narindra is an unmarried mother who has one child in preschool. The child’s father left her when she was pregnant, so he has not recognized the child. Voary Narindra is alone in meeting the responsibilities of parenthood. She is 23 years old. Due to this situation, she and her little one both live with her mother for the time being. 

Her business, the buying and selling of dried fish, is the source of her income. This is a business that she learned from her mother four years ago. Her dearest dream is to be autonomous and independent, to live alone with her child, and to have her own home (a house). She is a struggling young woman who is driven and hard-working.

loans.use: to purchase different sorts of dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase provisions, canned drinks, cookies, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 25-year-old married mother of two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Uldabanis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Uldabanis es una dama simpática y cariñosa que se rebusca su vida vendiendo mercancía puerta a puerta principalmente ropa, también vende productos como lociones, cremas de manos, desodorantes pero estos los realiza bajo encargo, ella es una mujer casada que junto con su esposo quieren lo mejor para su familia, mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha sido difícil pero todos sus esfuerzos valen la pena ya que lo hacen por sus dos hijos, una de 16 y otro de 11, para que estudien, vistan, coman bien, tenga útiles escolares y quieren seguir por el buen camino para realizarle el sueño a su hija mayor de entrar a una institución universitaria. 

Trabaja 5 días de la semana 8 horas cada uno, la principal razón de Uldabanis para buscar el emprendimiento antes que un trabajo es una enfermedad que le imposibilita realizar grandes esfuerzos físicos, y aunque el trabajo como vendedora tiene que realizar grandes desplazamientos es algo que puede soportar. 

Buscando mejorar sus ventas, generar mayor utilidad quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa para hombre y mujer, comprar un buen surtido de ropa deportiva ya que ir al gimnasio está tomando cada vez mas fuerza.
texts.en:
Uldabanis is a likeable and caring woman who has gone through life selling merchandise door to door. She mainly sells clothes, but also products such as lotions, hand creams, deodorants, but she sells these by order only. She is a married woman who along with her husband wants the best for their family. Improving their living conditions has been difficult but all their efforts are worth it since they are doing it for their two children, who are 16 and 11, so that they can study, have clothes to wear, eat well, have useful schooling and they want to follow the right path to make their oldest daughter's dream come true of entering a university institution.

She works 8 hours a day, 5 days a week. The main reason Uldabanis is looking for the business venture before a job is an illness that makes it impossible for her to exert herself physically, and although the work as a saleswoman she has to travel around, this is something that she can bear.

Uldabanis is looking to improve her sales and make the business more profitable, so she is asking for a loan to buy a stock of men's and women's clothing, and to buy some sports wear since going to the gym is helping her to get stronger and stronger.

loans.use: to buy stock of men's and women's clothes, and sports wear.

loans.name: Omaida Rosa

texts.es:
Omaida es una mujer veterana, campesina de nacimiento, se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, aprendió del trabajo gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, ella vive junto con su pareja no tiene hijos, antes trabajaba para generar lo suficiente para su sustento, ahora es una mujer diferente, un amigo le cambio la perspectiva, cambio y busca formas, ayudas para impulsar su negocio, llevarlo al éxito, dejar el conformismo y buscar alcanzar una meta de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Omaida quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimento. El monto es muy bajo puesto que quiere comprometerse con lo que puede pagar.
texts.en: Omaida is an experienced woman, a farmer by birth. She works raising pigs which she learned thanks to the teachings of her father. She lives together with her partner and has no children. Before she worked to generate enough for her sustenance, now she is a different woman. A friend changed her perspective she changed and found ways and help to boost her business, leading to success. Leaving behind her conformism and looking to better the goal of improving her house. Omaida wants to request a loan to buy pigs and feed. The amount is small as she only wants to commit to what she can afford to pay.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food to sustain them.

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Angel un hombre sonriente, alegre, esa persona que sabe subirle el ánimo a los demás con cualquier elocuencia que genera risa, se dedica a la venta de frutas, banano, mango, papaya, bananas y fresas, se encuentra pensando otra alternativa de negocio que es la que quiere que le brinden su ayuda para poder ejecutarla.

Angel quiere iniciar con la cría y venta de ganando porcino, por ello solicita muy amenamente un préstamo para la compra de surtido frutas y de dos cerdos con los que iniciara esta nueva aventura como porcicultor.

Con este préstamo espera poder tener dos actividades económicas que ayuden al sostenimiento y mejora de la calidad de vida de su familia conformada por su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad.
texts.en:
Angel is a cheerful, smiling man, a person who knows how to lift the spirits of others with an eloquent word that brings a laugh. He works selling fruit such as plantains, mangos, papayas, bananas and strawberries. He is currently thinking about another option for his business, which is why he is hoping for your help so that he can carry it out.

Angel wants to start raising and selling pigs, and for this he is requesting the kindness of a loan so that he can buy a variety of fruits as well as two pigs, with which he will start his new adventure as a pig farmer. 

With this loan, he hopes to have two economic activities which will help him maintain and improve the quality of life for his family, made up of his wife and his 16-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit as well as two pigs, with which he will start his new adventure as a pig farmer.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Décembre 2009 à l’occasion de son inauguration dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Actuellement à son onzième cycle le groupement commence à comprendre le programme. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Ramatoulaye, âgée de 40 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants dont 01 fille et 03 garçons. Elle s’active dans l’élevage.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02  bœufs à 85000f l’un, acheter 10 kg d’aliments pour bétails  à 10000 f et arrivée a terme, elle le revend en détails.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront d’acheter des chèvres, aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et aider aussi ses enfants (soins médicaux, scolarités et habillement)
texts.en:
Created on December 16, 2009 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated in the village square, this group has within it women who are determined to run revenue-generating businesses and to bolster their financial capacity. Now on their 11th cycle, the group members are beginning to understand about the program. The women have been living in the same village for several decades and maintain good solidarity amongst themselves. They are active in small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Ramatoulaye, aged 40 and sitting at the far right with a hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of four children (a girl and three boys). She is active in livestock farming. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 2 head of cattle at 85,000 francs each and 10 kg of feed at 10,000 francs and to resell them after a while. Her profits will enable her to purchase some goats, help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses, and also help her children (medical care, schooling costs, clothing).

loans.use: to purchase 2 head of cattle at 85,000 francs each and 10 kg of feed at 10,000 francs and to resell them when ready

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 37 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.

Leah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

Leah has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years.

Leah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
Ella es María una mujer orgullosa, una guerrera, mujer casada de 55 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos a los cuales les entrego su mejores años de vida por cuidarlos, protegerlos y guiarlos por un buen camino, ella siempre se desempeñó como ama de casa atendiendo a su marido e hijos y encontró que podría volverse muy productiva desde su casa, gracias a una clases que tomo en máquinas de confección, presto un dinero y compro una máquina de confección la cual vemos en la foto desde entonces diseña sus propias prendas tiene una línea propia la cual distribuye en almacenes y a personas comunes que llegan a su casa pidiendo a linda blusa o una pieza especial.

María trabaja 12 horas cada día de la semana, es de esas personas que no se pueden quedar sin hacer nada, pues hace su mayor esfuerzo por vender más, ser rentable, quiere consolidar un gran negocio para en un futuro dejarlo a sus hijos. 

Debido al alto costo de los insumos, el precio elevado del dólar, María no cuenta con el suficiente capital para la compra de los insumos que necesita para fabricar una nueva línea, es por ello que solicita su ayuda para poder comprar Telas, hilos, broches, elásticos entre otros productos que necesita.
texts.en:
María is a proud woman, a warrior. She is a 55 year old married woman. a mother of 5 who she gave the best years of her life to care for, protect and guide on a good path. She has always been an attentive housewife for her husband and children and found that she could be very productive from her house thanks to some sewing classes she took.

She borrowed some money and bought a sewing machine which we see in the photo and since then she has designed her own clothing. She has her own line of clothing that she distributes to stores and ordinary people who come to her house requesting a pretty blouse or some special piece.

María works 12 hours each day of the week, she is one of those people who can't sit with nothing to do. She makes her best effort to sell more, be profitable as she wants to build a big business to leave to her children in the future.

Due to the high costs of supplies, and the strength of the dollar María does not have enough capital to buy the supplies she needs to make a new line of clothing. So she is requesting your help to be able to buy fabric, thread, broaches and elastic amongst other products she needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, broaches and elastic amongst other products she needs.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa works hard to support her family. Clarissa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

Clarissa has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Clarissa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 44-year-old married mother of five children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Myrna has a general store business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.

Myrna has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for college to earn a bachelor's degree in commerce at the Laikipia university,Kenya

loans.name: Gadtaabatiiyisooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA est la représentante du groupe GADTAABATIIYISOOMA. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 15ans.  02 vont  à l’école.
Madame vend du charbon de bois  depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les vendeurs en gros. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 03sacs de charbon de bois.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne pouvoir payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. SALAMATA is the representative of the group GADTAABATIIYISOOMA. She is a married mother of seven children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 15. Two go to school. Ms. SALAMATA has been selling charcoal for eight years. She gets her supplies from wholesalers. She wants to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal. Ms. SALAMATA wants to use her profits to expand her business. Her ambition is to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of  charcoal

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is a driver at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 37 years old and married with three children, all of them in primary school.

Kwaku is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Muhyiddin

texts.en:
Meet one of Ruma’s agents, Muhyiddin, who lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, He lives there with his wife and his two children. Muhyiddin owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology. Muhyiddin is a friendly and hard-working agent and his community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Muhyiddin needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Then, the community members can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Muhyiddin’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. Muhyiddin is in the photo sitting in front of his  stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: A loan amount of 1000 WST will help Molly to buy paint brushes, paints, rolling materials, designs, and containers to help her run her business. Molly runs a business of selling elei printing (a style of cloth printing unique to Samoa) at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. She is 54 years old with 4 children. She became a member of SPBD in 2015. Molly will use her profit to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, paint, rolling materials, designs, and containers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna lives at Solana with her family. She is 51 years old now. To gain income, she sells fish and other seafood to customers in her community and nearby villages. She wants to improve her sales but has insufficient funds to increase her goods to sell. So, she joined ASKI and is now borrowing PHP 8,000 to buy buy more fish, shrimp and crabs to re-sell for profit. Lorna hopes to continue developing good relationships with her customers who will help her gain good profits in return.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shrimp and crab to re-sell for profit.

loans.name: Nele

texts.en: Nele is 32 years old with four children. She runs a business selling handicrafts at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Nele hopes to expand her business but to do this, she needs a loan of 1500 WST to buy carvings, sign-paper, chain saw, paint color, paint brush, and container to help run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011. She will use her profit to support her family and business.

loans.use: to buy carvings, sign-paper, chain saw, paint color, paint brush, and container,

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family.

Ma. Theresa has an E-Loading business (selling prepaid mobile phone credits) in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from the sale of personal products.  She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional prepaid credits for her E-Loading business.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, expand her business, and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid mobile phone credits.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana es una ama de casa como muchas, tiene su esposo, dos hijos, le gusta trabajar, ganarse sus propios ingresos, por ello trabaja en la venta de blue jean, los cuales distribuye entre amigos y familiares, al estar cerca de la fecha de día de la madre (en Colombia que se celebra el segundo domingo del mes de mayo),  Ana piensa que es una perfecta oportunidad para realizar una agresiva campaña de promoción de sus productos, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la mercancía, es por ello que le pide cordialmente que la apoyen para comprar pantalones para dama, este préstamo impulsara el negocio de una ama casa como Ana que procura por ser productiva y no ser una persona mantenida.
texts.en: Ana is a housewife.  She has her husband and two children.  She likes to work and earn her own income, so she works selling blue jeans.  She mostly sells to friends and people she knows.  Since it is getting close to Mother's Day (in Colombia, it is celebrated on the second Sunday in May), Ana thought it would be a perfect opportunity for a strong promotional campaign for her products.  However, she does not have enough capital to purchase the merchandise, so she is requesting your support to purchase women's pants.  This loan will drive businesses of housewives like Ana who want to be productive and not rely on others.

loans.use: to purchase jeans to sell.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yuri, who lives in Klaten, located in the capital of Central Java, Yuri is a university student who has a strong desire to become an entrepreneur. That's why decided to join Ruma. Yuri is a friendly and hard-working agent and his community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Yuri needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community members so they can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they apart. Yuri’s goal for the near future is to start an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. Yuri is in the photo holding Ruma's poster. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Kasoga Group

texts.en:
Medard is a 26-year-old male Ugandan and a resident of Kasoga in the Hoima district. He operates his agricultural produce business selling corn, millet and beans. He and most of the other group members have grown up in a place predominantly known for farming.
He is borrowing through his group of Kasoga Tukwatanise which is applying for a loan of 11,500,000 UGX. Medard will use his share to invest in his produce business. He will buy and store dry corn from the farmers and sell to buyers from the city when prices rise.
His plan for the future is to buy enough land to carry out commercial farming, He describes himself as an honest, hard-working person and says the challenges he faces include limited capital. 
The group appreciates the Kiva partnership and is committed to pay back the loan so that they can strengthen the partnership.

loans.use: To buy corn to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. Nelia is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Nelia has been in this business for seven years now..

In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is a 58-year-old married mother of 10 children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Normalita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Normalita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Normalita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 47 years old and married with three children, all in school.

Jona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jona has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from fishing and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Jona aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme veuve et mère de deux enfants. Agée de 36 ans, Akouvi vit à Agoè et fait le commerce de chaussures dans tout son quartier afin de gagner le revenu pouvant leur permettre un bon épanouissement. Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois au marché. Akouvi demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons de chaussures et réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice afin de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs éducations.
texts.en:
Akouvi, age 36, is the widowed mother of two children. She lives in Agoè where she sells shoes around the whole neighborhood to earn the income necessary to ensure her family’s well-being. 

Akouvi has bought merchandise three times at the market. She is seeking this loan to order boxes of shoes to sell. She hopes to make substantial profits and be able to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Drissa est le monsieur qui  tient la corde du bélier sur la photo.
Drissa est  un  malien  non scolarisé âgé de 50 ans, marié et  Père de 07 enfants, âgés de 6 mois à  19 ans dont 3  sont scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 Drissa fait  l’élevage des béliers, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses béliers  en ville.  Il  a une expérience de 20 ans  d’activité.
 Dans ses ventes, il gagne en moyenne  15000 FCFA de profit par Béliers. Avec le profit,  Drissa  pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).  Il est souvent confronté à certaines difficultés (mort ou perte de béliers) et  aux  coûts  chers  des frais de transport des béliers  mais organise généralement  le voyage avec des éleveurs  de sa localité pour relever les défis.
Dans l’avenir  Drissa veut  un prêt beaucoup plus  élevé pour développer son  activité  d’élevage pour gagner plus de profit afin de se construire une maison en tôle  pour sa  famille.
texts.en:
Drissa is the gentleman holding the ram’s leash in the photo. He is Malian, uneducated, aged 50, and the married father of seven children, who are aged 6 months old to 19 years old. Three of the children are in school. Drissa raises sheep. He is taking out a loan at RMCR to purchase many rams. He supplies himself from nearby fairs and resell the rams in town. He has over twenty years of experience in this business. 

In his selling, he earns 15,000 francs CFA of profit per ram, on average. With the profits, he will be able to meet the needs of his family (clothing, healthcare, schooling costs). He is often confronted with certain difficulties (death or loss of livestock) and with the high costs of transporting livestock. But he generally organizes trips with livestock farmers from his town to meet the challenges. 

For the future, Drissa wants a much larger loan for developing his livestock business in order to earn more, so as to build a sheet-metal house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rams to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Punnrith

texts.en: Punnrith is 18 years old, a student who lives in the Pursat province of Cambodia. He is in his first year of studies at a university in the province, majoring in mathematics. His father is a secondary school teacher and his mother is a primary school teacher. Punnrith is requesting a loan because he needs finances to cover his university fees and buy study materials for the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him to earn a bachelor’s degree and to learn his favorite skills. After graduation, he wants to be a good math teacher.

loans.use: to cover his university fees and buy study materials for the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Ellima

texts.en: Ellima, 27, is a dairy farmer in Chemagel Village in the rural Litein area of Kenya. This charming mother started dairy farming in 2010 in a run-down farm. Today, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows various types of food crops. Her main income sources are milk and eggs. Ellima is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Her farm has enough room for more cows, but she is taking it one step at a time. The additional cow on the farm will help utilize the available space and pasture. There are other merits to this expansion such as increased production of milk and reduced chances of shortages in case one animal cannot be milked for a particular reason. Ellima is going to use the profits from this investment to pay for her children's education. The availability of more milk will benefit her family in terms of food security and increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Dionisia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer casada, madre de 4 varones ya todos ellos mayores de edad, desde su casa realiza su actividad económica la cual es la venta de productos congelados, con la utilidad que le genera su negocio está logrando pagar sus deudas, apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar, darse sus gustos y ahora quiere empelar todos sus esfuerzos en la consolidación de una distribuidora de productos congelados, ser la número uno en la ciudad.

Martha aprendió del negocio empíricamente lo trabaja de lunes a domingo 7 horas por día.

Martha en busca de capitalización, sostenibilidad y mejora en ventas todos estos esfuerzos enfocados en una meta la cual es tener una distribuidora de productos congelados quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una nevera para almacenar productos terminados e insumos como bananas, endulzantes, carnes, panzerotis, palitos de queso, pasteles, empanadas entre otros.
texts.en:
Martha is married and the mother of four sons who are all adults.  She works from her home selling frozen products.  With the income she earns from her business, she is able to pay her debts, help her husband with the household expenses, and get what she likes.  Now she wants to put all of her effort into becoming a frozen products distributor and being the best in her city.

Martha learned the business through experience and works seven hours a day from Monday to Sunday.

Martha is in search of capital, sustainability, and improving her sales.  All of her efforts are focused on her goal of becoming a frozen products distributor.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer to store finished products and to buy supplies like bananas, sweeteners, meats, calzones, cheese sticks, cakes, empanadas, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to keep finished products and get supplies like bananas, sweeteners, meats, calzones, cheese sticks, cakes, empanadas, and other items.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She lives in a small village where many people do business in order to feed their families. Shahlo is married and has four children. She has 11 years of experience of doing business. She has her own small store where she sells grocery products like sugar, milk, bread, toys, napkins, nappies, food, candies, etc. Every day she has regular customers and earns money to feed her children and big family. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to enlarge her business and buy food and grocery products. She awaits the kindness of Kiva lenders and IMON.

loans.use: To buy food and grocery products

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a smallholder farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya, where he recently introduced zero-grazing on his dairy farm. To a man like Patrick, feed management is everything. Unlike most local farmers, Patrick embraces new and better ways of dairy farming. Patrick's major problem is lack of adequate capital to buy high quality animal feed. As a result, he uses by-products from crops to feed his animals. To change that, he is seeking external financing through Kiva to buy high quality animal feed that contain nutrients and minerals ideal for a cow to be healthy and highly productive. Your loan will push him miles forward, and income generated from this investment will be used to meet the basic needs of his wife of five years and two children ages seven and thirteen.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Sopian

texts.en:
Sopian lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, Indonesia, about a 5-hour drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his only child. He was introduced to Kiva's partner, PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma), from Ruma's sales executive that came to his house. Sopian is really excited to be a part of Ruma’s network because he hopes that these services will bring more customers to his stall and increase his income.

With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he is now offering to process mobile phone payment and bill payment (like electricity, water, etc) services for customers in his local community. To do this, he needs to get a loan from Kiva. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase more mobile phone payment credits for his customers. His goal for his business is to become a trusted mobile payment service provider for his community. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile phone airtime purchases and utility bill payments for customers.

loans.name: Akowa

texts.fr: Akowa est une femme veuve âgée de 38 ans et œuvre activement pour la réussite de sa vie. Akowa est mère de quatre enfants et habite dans le quartier d’Agoè. Pour répondre aux besoins quotidiens de la famille, Akowa vend du riz et du haricot préparé afin de trouver le revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Très entreprenante, Akowa s’approvisionne  quatre  fois par mois au marché. Akowa sollicite ce prêt pour commander un sac du haricot et un sac du riz et trouver plus de bénéfice pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akowa, age 38, is the widowed mother of four children who works hard to have a successful life. She lives in the district of Agoè. Eager to meet her family’s day-to-day needs, Akowa sells a dish of made of rice and beans to make the necessary income. 

Akowa has a strong entrepreneurial spirit. She stocks up four times per month at the market. She is seeking this loan to order one sack of beans and one sack of rice. She hopes to bolster her profits in order to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one sack of beans and one sack of rice.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is a married mother of 7 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and 5 of her children are currently in school.

Jenilyn has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 24,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Jenilyn has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her busines and continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a passionate and hardworking 24-year-old entrepreneur from the Nkubu area of Kenya. The bachelor owns a one-acre piece of land on which he has been carrying out dairy farming for the last 5 years. So far, he has 3 cows, named Mutune, Kairu and Kalemba (vernacular meaning brown, black and white spots respectively). Besides cows, Alex also keeps poultry and grows bananas. When he is not farming, he is shopkeeping at his retail outlet. Alex's aspiration is to become a successful dairy farmer.
To become more productive as a dairy farmer, Alex is focusing on feed management to boost productivity. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, and he will use the money to purchase a chaff cutter that he will use for processing fodder. He also plans to purchase, from agro-vet stores, feed that contains nutrients and minerals that help cows grow healthier and more productive.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter and feed for his animals

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans et mariée, Adjo est une femme qui vit à Agoè. Mère de trois enfants, Adjo fait des savons préparés à l’aide de la soude et de l’huile de palme. Adjo est très dynamique et arrive à trouver son bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Adjo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois. Pour commander de la soude et de l’huile de palme, Adjo demande ce microcrédit pour réaliser ses achats et réaliser plus de bénéfice pour permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo, age 30, is a married mother to three children who lives in Agoè. She makes soaps using caustic soda and palm oil. She is a very dynamic woman who manages to earn a profit through this activity. 

Adjo buys supplies four times a month. She is seeking this loan to buy caustic soda and palm oil. This will help to bolster her profits and to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 3 cartons of caustic soda and 2 jugs of palm oil to make soaps.

loans.name: Mamere

texts.en: Mamere is a Samoan citizen, and she is 23 years old, with one child. She operates a business of selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year and now hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this Mamere needs a loan of 1,000 WST to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), and banana roots (seedlings). She became a member of SPBD in 2015. Mamere will use her profit to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), and banana roots (seedlings)

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Merlinda is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Merlinda works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company's or client’s needs. She uses a sewing machine and stitching machines, and she also hand stitches hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas for employees like Merlinda is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Merlinda is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 16,000 PHP loan to redeem the ATM card that she pawned.

Merlinda hopes to give her children a better future, and she dreams of their lives prospering. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness, and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Merlinda before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned ATM card.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 65 years old, and she is married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar, etc.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is married and works hard to support her family. She sells rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Alyn requested a loan from NWTF for 11,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Osneira Lucia

texts.es:
Osneira con 38 años de edad es casada y madre de 1 hijo. Toda su vida fue criada en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano y complementa con la producción de pollos, tanto la cosecha de plátano, como los pollos y huevos que produce su finca, son vendidos en el mercado de Chigorodo, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Osneira es una mujer seria, responsable, comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y la de su hijo, al cual le podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tenga un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Osneira is 38 years old, married, and the mother of one son. She was raised in the country and has lived there all her life, and she has done farm work for most of her life. 

She currently grows plantains, and she complements this with chicken production. Both the plantains she harvests and the chickens and eggs produced by her farm are sold at the Chigorodo market. In this way she obtains sufficient resources to provide the daily sustenance for her household. 

Osneira is a serious and responsible woman who is committed to her family and her work. Thus, she always wants to keep making progress in the quest for a better future. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in buying agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, with the aim of continuing to care for her crops and obtaining a harvest under optimal conditions. All of this will help her move forward and gradually improve her standard of living and that of her son, for whom she will be able to provide a better education so that he can have a prosperous future full of success.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is married and has five children. He is a smallholder farmer from Kitale, Kenya, which he has been doing for 13 years. 

This year Japheth started commercial poultry farming with 12 heads of poultry. For the poultry business to have significant returns, he needs to add more hens. He is requesting a loan, which eh will use to buy poultry. He has plans of growing and diversifying his farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Wiliter

texts.en:
Wiliter, 29, is a smallholder farmer in the Litein area of Kenya. Over the past 8 years, she has bred more than 2 dairy cows, developed her farm, and planted and sold a variety of crops. She says the secret to her success is thinking of farming as a way to earn money, not just as a traditional way of life. Adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping, and good planning also help. 

Wiliter was unable to study for a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming since. She says, “I have always had an affinity for farming; it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to produce between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Wiliter also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides which she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Wiliter is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and have a crop output larger than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. She believes that through her loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Wiliter's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 57 years old, married and has eight children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Emma has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emma has been farming rice for ten years now and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás es un hombre muy agradecido, porque  se encuentra muy satisfecho por el apoyo brindado, gracias a ello logro comprar sus herramientas y mejoro la calidad  de sus servicios,  el ahora ya tiene mucha demanda de albañilería,  pero ahora el necesita un nuevo crédito porque ve la necesidad de adquirir un chorro de agua potable, porque él no cuenta con ese servicio.
Nicolás tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir el crédito para poder brindarle a su familia mas comodidad.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a very grateful man, because he is very happy about the support provided to him. Thanks to it, he has been able to buy his tools and improve the quality of his services. Now he is in great demand as a mason, but he needs a new loan because he has seen the need to acquire a drinking water connection, since he does not currently have this service. 

Nicolás hopes to be able to obtain the loan so that he can provide more comfortable conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install a connection for drinking water services.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: A 33 ans, Akouavi est une femme veuve et mère de deux  enfants. Akouavi vit dans le quartier d’Agoè. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Akouavi vend du sel en parcourant son quartier afin de gagner sa vie. Akouavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akouavi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de sel afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouavi, age 33, is a widowed mother to two children. She lives in the district of Agoè. To provide for her children, she makes a living by selling salt as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood.   

Akouavi buys salt twice a month at the market. She is seeking this loan to buy sacks of salt. She hopes to bolster her profits and support her children’s academic schooling.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of salt.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 32-year-old woman with 4 children who has run a business to sell coconut drinks and fruit salad for a year. 

Stella needs a loan of $2000 WST to buy fruit, containers, coolers, coconut drinks, straws, plastic cups, timber, paint, and a paint brush for home improvement. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

 Stella became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy fruit, containers, coolers, coconut drinks, straws, plastic cups, timber, paint, and a paint brushes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the vegetable farm

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Elvira and her husband help each other in managing their furniture-making business within their community. They aim to improve this business and make it profitable in order to earn sufficient income and support the education of their two children. Having insufficient capital, Elvira is asking for an loan of 5,000 PHP to buy wood, varnish, nails, plywood, and other materials needed in making furniture. Through hard work and strong determination, they believe that someday they will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, nails, plywood, and other materials needed

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks. Thanh is 36 years old and married with 2 children. Her business is in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thanh has been involved in this business for 3 years.

In 2014, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Thanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Mrs Thoa works in agriculture, farming food. Thoa is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Thoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2011, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thoa has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Thoa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Thoa hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is a married woman who works hard to support her family. She has sold food for 5 years and requests 10,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bananas, ube, milk, and sugar.

In the future, Rubelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas, ube, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with three children who works hard to support her family.

She sells fruit and vegetables and earns additional income from food vending. Janice is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell to customers.

Janice has sustained her business  through  4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 30-year-old married woman with four school-aged children who is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has had a fishing business for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase anadditional fishing net.

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Jeanilyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Daylen

texts.en:
Daylen is 25 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Daylen has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Daylen is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Kurtali

texts.en:
Kurtali wants to buy a pump sprayer to spray his orchards with fertilizer.
 
Kurtali is 58-year-old married man who lives in southeastern Albania, which is  known for its large production of gold apples. 

He has been an arboriculturist for 20 years as the source of income for his family. He has apple orchards and sells organic fruit to wholesale buyers who then sell them to Montenegro, Macedonia, and Croatia. 

He states that his wife and he have been busy with this type of activity for a very long time. It has been lots of work, but they enjoy it.

loans.use: to buy a pump sprayer to spray the apple orchards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Satijah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Satijah. Satijah lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Satijah lives there with her husband and her two children. She owns a small stall where she sells Indonesian women's clothes and provides mobile payment services for her community. As a woman, Satijah realized that she needs to help her husband to increase more of their income so they can save more for their children's education. That's why she decided to join Ruma.

Satijah knew Ruma from one of sales executives who came to her stall. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Satijah sees improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Satijah improves her business and, accordingly, her community, who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Satijah is the one who is sitting in front of her own small stall. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 22 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan.

The main harship that Trang faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Trang hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda  thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional 'piaya' and also other sweet pasalubongs (the Filipino tradition of travelers bringing gifts from  their destination to people back home) like pili nuts, mangos, and cashew nuts  which are needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and pay expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business if you will lend her 30,000 PHP. This new loan will purchase piaya, cashew nuts, and other sweets. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit. This will help her business to become viable and sustainable. 

Melinda aims to have more varieties of pasalubongs to sell to her customers. She meets weekly with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piaya, pili nuts, mangos, cashew nuts,  and other items.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 61-year-old married woman with five children who works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma has run a general store for 10 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

She sells snack food, sardines, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, one attends school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 7 years and requests 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy coffee, milk, soap, and shampoo.

She earns additional income from food vending.

loans.use: to buy coffee, milk, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 42 years old. She is married and has six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like coffee, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Liezel has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling assorted toys.

She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like coffee, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is married and lives in the Baku region with his wife and children. His wife is a homemaker while he has been in the taxi business for many years. He has taken out and repaid two prior loans, which he used to grow his business and increase his income. He is requesting a new loan for 600 AZN to repair his taxi, which he is unable to use at present, so that he can restore and further increase his income. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, because this will help him to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adán de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco  hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, posee 28 años de experiencia en el cultivo, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra abono, sulfato de amonio, abono foliar, herbicidas, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos económico.
texts.en:
Adan is 51 years old. He lives in his own home with his five children. 

He works growing corn, sorghum, and beans. He has 28 years of experience as a farmer. He sells his products to agencies that buy and sell basic grains. With what he obtains from his sales he can meet some of the household expenses. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer, ammonium sulfate, foliar fertilizer, herbicides, pest control, and improve the land shown in the photograph so he can continue with his crops and thus have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, ammonium sulfate, foliar fertilizer herbicides, pest control, and improve the soil

loans.name: Bé

texts.en:
Bé is 25 years old and she is married with no children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Bé has a retail business selling medication. She has been involved in this business for one year.

The main hardship that Bé faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Bé's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bé hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 5 años, actividad que realiza con su compañero de vida, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmayos y redes para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated, as she is 20 years old and lives in a high risk area, has been earning a living by fishing for 5 years. She works alongside her life partner, and they sell their products in the different markets that are found near to their home. From what they obtain from their sales they manage to get by. She lives in her own home with her life partner and their child. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets to continue with her work and thus obtain a better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Manila

texts.en: Manila is a 37-year-old mother with seven children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Manila has requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 32 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thúy has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Lan has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the medical expenses of a motor vehicle accident and the treatment so that her mother can properly recover.

loans.name: Quyên

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyên has a retail business, selling clothes. She is 38 years old and married, with three children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Quyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Quyên has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Quyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water pipes

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Eden works very hard to provide for them.

Eden runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eden has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries.

In the future Eden would like to save money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида, 41 год, замужем, 5 детей. Образование-высшее, работает учителем. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 10 овец, на 1,50 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает рис. Ежемесячный доход Фариды составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Фарида обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Фарида является участником группы "Жоогазын", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита Фарида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Farida is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She has a higher education and works as a teacher. Today, her farmstead has six cows and ten sheep, and she grows rice on 1.50 hectares of her own and 2.0 hectares of rented lend. Farida's monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). Farida has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.

Farida is a member of the "Zhoogazyn" group in which there are another three people besides her, for a total of four. Farida plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase her number of livestock.

loans.use: to increase her number of livestock.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 34 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ana Marie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like soap, sugar, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Ana Marie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, sugar, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rona works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF for her fish vending business, to buy more fish to sell.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is a 59-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Taguig, Philippines who has been operating a transportation business, particularly for trucks, for almost seven years. She makes a very good income from this, but is determined to work harder to provide for her family. Her children are helping her generate income for their everyday needs. Francia is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan to continue operating her business by buying spare parts and accessories and also to maintain her trucks. Her goal for the future is to improve her business by having more trucks available. She hopes that her family is always in good health and wants her children to finish their studies so they can get good, secure jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to equip and maintain trucks.

loans.name: Bắc

texts.en:
Bắc is 50 years old and is married with two children. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Bắc does not have any dependents to support with her business, which is located in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Bắc faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet. This is Bắc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna is married and the mother of ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who is 49 years old and has three children in school. She runs a fish-vending business in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 9,500 loan from NWTF to buy more seafood to sell. Erna has been in this business for three years. Her goal for the future to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Margaret from Kisii in Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming but who is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and together with her husband is blessed with five lovely children. For the past 20 years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from her fellow farmers and she is regarded as a mentor. The income from selling milk, eggs and maize have allowed her to earn a decent income. To earn extra income, Margaret engages in a small personal business.

Margaret passionately loves dairy farming and the animals on her farm have been given the names “Maridadi and Nyangera.” Milking and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Demand has been overwhelming and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow.

Margaret does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow but she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15-20 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Margaret will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school going children.

When anybody listens to Margaret speak, one would be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming but because of her passion and determination she intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change Margaret's living standards and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanzo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Eunice, a member of Mwanzo Women Group. She is married and has four children.

Her economic activity is dairy farming. She also keeps poultry. Training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled her to manage her business well. She needs a loan to buy animal feed, such as fodder and layers mash (chicken feed). She hopes that the income level from her business will increase to improve her living standards by allowing her to pay school fees for her children and afford good clothing and food for them.

Eunice is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fodder and chicken feed to boost milk and egg production.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Salina is 69 years old, married and blessed with nine children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has learned about enterprise development and financial management. She has been dairy farming for the last two years and the income she earned has allowed her to provide her family with food and also meet other household expenses. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy fodder for her cows and also to start a poultry business. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cows and chickens.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Emily, 46 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. Emily does maize, potato and bean farming. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and profitably unlike before.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. This will increase her farm production and meet the demand for potatoes, thus earning her more income and going a long way in supporting her children’s education and family's basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer that will help boost farming for more harvest.

loans.name: Tia Bidii Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady lifting her hand is called Beatrice. She is 34 years old and married with two children.

Having gone through the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she has gained much knowledge on good enterprise and financial management skills, which has greatly helped her to improve the management of her enterprises. She has also adopted a good saving culture.

She is a farmer and also sells clothes. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more clothes to add stock to her clothing sales business, which will increase her income and enable her to take care of her two children.

She is happy about having access to Kiva and its lenders, and she promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add stock to her clothing sales business, which will increase her income and enable her to take care of her two children.

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is 23 years old and has one child. She operates a business where she sells banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Fuatino has requested a loan to assist her in running her business, to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals. She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Calama Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 30 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento comercial, la manufactura en todas las áreas y por los orígenes de su población proveniente de tribus ‘Ayoreas’ nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país, de clima subtropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
