Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow, as Ndaragwa has a thriving market for dairy products. Rhoda has sustained herself through dairy farming for 10 years now and enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. 

Roda has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Rhoda is kindly requesting KES 50,000 to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm, and as a result, she will have more  for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. 

With increased income resulting from the loan, Rhoda plans to spend money to settle the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Rhoda will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

Please help out this heroine!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tuzamuke Group

texts.en:
Tuzamuke is a group led by Augustin, who is 47 years old. The group name means “climb” in English. The group members all have the same idea for how to change their lives, and they sell different items.

Augustin is married with seven children aged between one and 19 years. He sells foodstuffs and has been in business for the past 12 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum, maize, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standards of living and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, maize, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Asaba

texts.en: Asaba lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a motorcycle transporter commonly known as ‘’bodaboda’’ and gets additional income from a retail shop. He started his motorcycle transport business three years back and continues to see progress in his business despite the challenges of unfriendly weather conditions and inadequate capital, which reduce his expected incomes. However, he used the previous loan to process a permit since it was a necessary tool for all motorcycle riders. He dreams of buying many motorcycles for transport business to get more profits. Asaba has asked for a loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.  

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase a new  stock  of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 55 años de edad, toda la vida fue independiente, anteriormente era un vendedor de calzado y de ropa, en el año 2012 constituyo su propio negocio el cual es el que podemos ver en la foto lo trabaja toda la semana 7 horas por día. 

Su padre fue quien lo involucro en este mundo del comercio y a sus 55 años de edad es lo que le da de comer.

Roberto no tuvo suerte con una mercancía que trajo a sus clientes no le llamo mucho la atención y su volumen de ventas ha sido bajo, por ello en vista de la situación quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de sandalias y calzado para dama, busca renovar su surtido para mejorar sus ventas.

Tu préstamo ayudara a un veterano a seguir ejerciendo su profesión a demostrarle que no está solo y que cuenta con el apoyo de muchos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Roberto is a man of 55, who has been independent his entire life. Previously he sold footwear and clothing, and in 2012 set up his own business, which is the one seen in the photo. He operates it all week, 7 hours a day.

His father was the one who got him involved in this world of sales, and at 55, this is how he supports himself.

Roberto was unlucky with a line of merchandise he offered to his customers. It did not attract much attention and his sales volume has been low. This is why, in view of the situation, he wants to apply for a loan to purchase a selection of sandals and women's footwear. He is seeking to update his selection in order to improve his sales. 

Your loan will help a veteran salesperson to continue exercising his occupation showing him that he is not alone and that he has the support of many people to succeed.

loans.use: To buy a supply of sandals and women's shoes. He is seeking to update his selection in order to improve his sales.

loans.name: Sidlawende Ii Group

texts.fr:
Madame LAMOUSSA est la  représentante  du groupe SIDLAWENDE II. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 16 ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Madame vend du bois de chauffe depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces.
Elle veut  s’acheter  05 rangées de bois.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Lamoussa is the representative of the group called Sidlawende II. She is doing very well. Married, she is the mother of four children. The oldest is 16 and the youngest 6 years old. Three of them attend school. 

Madame Lamoussa has been selling firewood for seven years. She buys her wood in the surrounding provinces. She would like to buy five cords of wood. 

Madame Lamoussa would like to save her profit. Her ambition is to grow her business and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 cords of wood

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a fourth time borrower with UGAFODE, with successful repayments. Now, Ivan is looking for UGX 3,000,000 so that he can buy more agriculture inputs to run his cattle trade at full capacity.

He is fully confident that he will repay this loan on time, like all of the previous ones.  Ivan is so certain that he will repay the loan on time, because he has a ready market. Thanks to the flexible repayment schedules of UGAFODE Microfinance.

UGAFODE is so pleased to continue to support Ivan as he continues to grow his business, and is so thankful for any support of this loan. He truly is pushing forward one step at a time and his business is thriving.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Augustino

texts.en:
Augustino has requested a loan of UGX 1,800,000. He is 37 years old. He is a first time borrower at UGAFODE MDI. He is married to one wife and has five children. The children are ages 12, 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old, respectively. He has one dependent.

Augustino is active in growing tea where he works for 10 hours a day. He started this business in 2001 and his business is located in rural areas at Orubingo in Bushenyi District.  He started this business so as to raise family incomes and meet basic needs. He says he will use the loan money to buy fertilizer which he anticipates will raise his yields. He sells his harvest to tea factories. Augustino's hope is to plant more tea plantations and educate his children. The main challenge he faces is price fluctuations and this affects his tea sales and profits most. He is hard working and appreciates UGAFODE services.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Musitafa is a new client of Kiva's partner, UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. He is 32 years old, married to Aisha with whom they have three children between the ages of one and five. Only one child attends school. He is a farmer with a banana and coffee plantation, and he has a retail shop to supplement his income. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help him restock his retail shop with items that are normally required by his customers. He hopes this will increase his sales and profit. He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale and thus will be able to increase his income. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in his store

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
Evelyn, a member of Discipline group, is 42 and a married mother with two children who are 29 and 15 years old. Both of her children go to school. She is standing second from left in the photograph and sells slipons and sandals door to door. She has been doing this job for three years to support her husband, who is a mason. As a mother, she would not sit back and leave all responsibilities on her husband so she saved some money, which enabled her to engage in the sale of ladies' dresses in town. This has enabled her to meet her family needs.

Evelyn has dreams of expanding her business and educating her children up to higher levels of learning so they have a bright future. Evelyn lacks enough capital, which has led to the sluggish growth of her business. She, therefore, needs a loan to boost her business. So together with Tawiah, Juliana, Gertrude and Leticia, the group needs a total of GHS 4,600 to boost their businesses.

loans.use: To buy slipons and sandals to sell door to door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy computers and reading books

loans.name: Kiganjo Ushindi S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person standing on the right hand side  on the photograph is Patricia.  She is 24 years old, married, and a mother of two children.

Patricia joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014. She has benefited a lot from the training, especially in saving, enterprise and financial management where she acquired skills of prudent saving methods and enterprise development. She has also gained skills on how to run her dairy enterprise well and manage her income prudently.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy meal for her cows, hoping to expand her dairy enterprise.  That will earn her more income, enabling her to cater to family needs with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the assistance, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds that will help boost farming

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife and his five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and has benefited from the trainings, which have equipped him with savings mobilization and financial management skills.

He practices dairy and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, which will boost his vegetables production. Hence, he will earn more income to enable him to take care of his five children.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, which will boost his vegetables production. Hence, he will earn more income to enable him to take care of his five children.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Agée de 57 ans, Victorine est une femme mariée qui vit avec six enfants à sa charge. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Victorine vend de la pâte bandée à l’aide du maïs pour disposer de son revenu. Victorine réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des bols de maïs, Victorine demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Victorine is a 57-year-old, married woman who is responsible for six children.  To help her family thrive, Victorine sells a wrapped corn paste for disposable income. She has had some success with this activity, and she is able to go to the market once a month. Victorine is asking for a loan to buy bowls of corn that will help her promote her business and have a profit margin that will better contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 175 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Phonyaeng Group

texts.en:
Khamla and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

The water filter Khamla and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khamla and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamla and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. Khamla is excited the filter is available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Toga

texts.en:
Toga joined SPBD in 2015. She is 36 years old with six children. She operates a business selling elei textile printing in her village and at the market to earn a living. She has experience for more than a year. 

Toga hopes to earn more profit from the business, but to do this she needs a loan to buy paint, rolling material, designs, paint brushes, and containers to assist her to run the business.

loans.use: to buy paint, rolling material, designs, paint brushes, and containers

loans.name: Nahun Group

texts.en:
Yua’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater, none of which is safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Yua and her group are excited that this water filter has become available on a payment plan that makes it much more affordable.  

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.  Yua and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this time frame, filter users like Yua’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 47 year old mother with 7 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Agnes needs a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil and boxes of milk, to assist her run the business. Agnes became a member of SPBD in 2014.

She will use her profit to support her family and business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil and boxes of milk.

loans.name: Fuamatala

texts.en:
Fuamatala is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a food stall business and also attends to her other two businesses, which are farming and livestock. Fuamatala has been conducting these businesses for more than ten years.

She is now requesting a loan to buy four large pots, a large industrial stove, a freezer, timber and nails, sprayers, chemicals, and loads of crops.

She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. Fuamatala hopes to one day support her family on her own and pay for their every need.

loans.use: to buy four large pots, a large industrial stove, a freezer, timber and nails, sprayers, chemicals, and  loads of crops.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

Arlyn has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат, 46 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Образование-высшее, на сегодняшний день она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 20 овец, на 1,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает рис. Ежемесячный доход Гулзат составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Гулзат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Гулзат является участником группы "Жоогазын", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита Гулзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 46 and married with three children. She has a higher education and works in agriculture. She has three cows and 20 sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of her own land where she grows rice. Her monthly income is about 20,000 KGS.

Gulzat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She is a member of the Zhoogazyn group, which consists of herself and three other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like pork, chicken, other frozen foods, etc., for her food vending business.

Alona has been in this business for two years. Alona earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like pork, chicken, other frozen foods, etc

loans.name: Vieng Group

texts.en: Saengchan understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Saengchan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Saengchan purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.   Saengchan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 38-year-old married mother of two children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community.

 Farzana owns a small business selling clothing of various colors from home. She purchases clothing from the main market at a low price and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of her town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the hot weather has started and people need summer clothing. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of clothing to fulfill the demand. Farzana hopes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fancy clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Silafaga

texts.en: Silafaga is a 40-year-old mother of 10 children. She is a Samoan citizen who owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Silafaga needs a loan  to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan to help run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 53 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Carmencita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soap, chips, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell at her store.

Carmencita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, chips, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell at her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Esther. She is a super incredible farmer! She certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list. 

Born in 1971, into a humble family, Esther's upbringing was difficult. She attended school and cleared secondary, after which she got into mixed farming 20 years ago. She also got married to a lovely and good looking husband. Together, they are blessed with four children. 

Esther practices farming on a five-acre farm that is owned by the family in the village of Kachibora. On the farm, she grows maize and a variety of food crops. She also keeps more than four highly productive dairy cows for milk production. The 44-year-old farmer sells her produce in bulk two kilometers from her home. Her key clients are the Cereal Board, institutions and local people. She is also a good member of Kibangenge Group, a group she formed to help members who are smallholder farmers to save and use the savings to access loans from financial institutions. 

Esther is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy poultry. The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 120,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

As a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. With the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

Esther has a great credit history. Profits from this investment will be put back into the business to fuel further growth. So much space on her land still remains for future growth. If ever there was an opportunity to invest a $25 loan in someone's future, it is here. You won't regret it.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Barnaiym

texts.ru: Барнайым, 35 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Образование-среднее, на сегодняшний день она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 7 коров, на 1,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает рис. Ежемесячный доход Барнайым составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Барнайым обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Барнайым является участником группы "Жоогазын", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Barnaiym is 35 and married with three children. She has a high school education and currently works in farming. She has seven cows on her farm as well as 1 hectare of her own land where she grows rice. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

Barnaiym has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She is a member of the Zhoogazyn group, which consists of herself and three other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and into home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гулбарчын, 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Гулбарчын в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гулбарчын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 7 коров, 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец для увеличения поголовья. Гулбарчын является лидером группы "Ынтымак", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Гулбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulbarchyn is 34 and married with four children. She works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 15 years ago. Thanks to her hard work she currently has seven cows and five sheep on her farm. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulbarchyn has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase five sheep to increase her herd. She is the leader of the Intymak group, which consists of three other people besides herself. She plans to put profits from her loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy five sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a lovely lady, from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, and her passion for farming runs deeper than deep. She has been married for 15 years, and has four children. 

She started farming from scratch 13 years ago, and today, she is on another level. Janet's two-acre farmland has one dairy cow, five goats and over 50 heads of poultry. In terms of plants, she irrigates her horticultural farm and has over 70 trees. 

Janet is seeking a loan to buy water pipes to be used for irrigation and other purposes, such as filling water troughs for animals, cleaning, etc.

Water is a key resource for any farmer, and having tools that will make management of water resources more efficient is very important to Janet.

loans.use: to buy water pipes to be used for irrigation, filling troughs for animals, cleaning, etc.

loans.name: Mpeefu A-Kbs Listeners Group

texts.en:
Jolly is a 35-year-old single mother of five, ages 16, 12, 10, 8 and 2. Four children attend school and Jolly is responsible for paying their school fees and meeting their other needs.
Jolly’s major source of income is her business, which is a bar, but she also carries out farming on small scale. This helps to feed her children.
Jolly has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 through her group of Mpeefu- A-Kbs to restock her bar with both soft drinks and alcoholic beverages that are demanded by her customers. Jolly is hopeful this will help her to earn profits to pay back the loan with ease. Her dream for the future is to build a good house for her family.
She describes herself as a hard working and honest person in business.
Jolly is seated at the extreme right in the photo .

loans.use: To buy drinks to sell in the bar

loans.name: Igli

texts.en:
This is Igli, a 29-year-old single man. His focus has been on looking after his father, who has been very sick, and on farming. Agriculture has been Igli's livelihood since he turned 18. His family did not own agricultural land so he has rented land to grow mainly wheat, potatoes, and beans. He then sells the produce to wholesale buyers. Note that the region of Korca where he resides is known for the most delicious potatoes and beans.
Igli is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his seasonal planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the spring planting of beans, potatoes and wheat.

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Ella es Rosalba es una mujer trabajadora ha vivido 64 años, se separó de su esposo con quien tuvo 3 hijos ya mayores de edad y con familia, ella es muy laboriosa y se consigue su propio sustento gracias a sus habilidades culinarias, vende almuerzos los cuales realiza a fuego de carbón.

Rosalba trabaja por una única ambición su mantenimiento y comprar una vivienda, este el sueño de esta adorable abuela y sonríe porque lo lograra no sabe como pero lo lograra.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para preparar bandeja paisa, sudado, sancocho, mondongo que son platos típicos de la región antioqueña. 

Es tan sorprendente esta dulce abuela que trabaja aun teniendo una incapacidad.
texts.en:
This is Rosalba, a hard working woman who has lived 64 years. She separated from her husband with whom she had 3 children, all adults now and with families. She is hard-working and she supports herself with her culinary abilities. She sells lunch meals which she prepares over charcoal flames. Rosalba works for her only one ambition, to maintain and buy a home. This is the dream of this adorable grandmother. She smiles because she knows she will achieve her goal, she does not know how but she will.

She requests a loan to buy ingredients to prepare “bandeja paisa” (a traditional popular dish that includes beans, rice, ground beef, chorizo with lime, plaintain, avocado, “arepa” or corn cake, fried egg and a slice of “chicharrón” or fried pork belly), “sudado” (Colombian style chicken stew), sancocho (thick soup made with root vegetables and different kinds of meats) and mondogo (pork, tripe and chorizo soup). These are typical dishes of the Antioqueña region.  This sweet grandmother is so amazing that she works even though she has a disability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare, bandeja paisa, sudado, sancocho, mondongo, popular dishes from the Antioqueña region.

loans.name: Sitaua

texts.en:
Sitaua is a 45-year-old single mother of six children. She runs a very profitable retail shop in her village and also a mechanical shop to earn more income. She has been managing these businesses for more than 20 years. 

Sitaua is now requesting a loan to purchase two new freezer chests, a new display refrigerator case, frozen goods, snacks, canned items, drinks and cigarettes. Sitaua has been with SPBD since 2007. She hopes to keep expanding her business for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase two new freezer chests, a new display refrigerator case, frozen goods, snacks, canned items, drinks and cigarettes.

loans.name: Lotolua

texts.en:
Lotolua is a Samoan citizen. She is 30 years old and single. She operates a business of selling taro and bananas in her village and at the market. She has gained a lot from her business. 

Lotolua hopes to expand her business for a better future, but to do this, Lotolua needs a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow and chainsaw for her business. 

She will use her profits to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow and chainsaw for her business.

loans.name: Asotasi

texts.en:
Asotasi is 36 years old and married with five children. 

She has a small farm where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Asotasi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow and a new pair of overalls. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Asotasi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow and a new pair of overalls.

loans.name: Anarosa

texts.en:
Anarosa is 23 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei (traditional Samoan decorative) printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for six years. 

Anarosa has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2009, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers and wooden carved designs.

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: Sandra de 21 años de edad es una joven trabajadora que vive junto a su compañero de vida. Todos los días Sandra sale a trabajar en una empresa cercana, en la cual ya lleva algunos años laborando, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con el beneficio económico que le brinda, además su compañero de vida, también aporta a los gastos económicos de su hogar. Como se observa en la fotografía la vivienda de Sandra se encuentra muy deteriorada, por lo que no cuenta con las medidas de seguridad necesarias para habitar, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y lámina para mejorar su vivienda y de esta manera poder habitarla tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 21, is a hardworking young woman who lives with her life companion. Every day she leaves for her job at a company nearby where she has worked for a few years. She is pleased to have the financial benefits that her job provides. In addition, her companion helps with the household expenses.

As shown in the photograph, Sandra’s home is an extremely deteriorated state. She lacks the necessary safety measures to make her house inhabitable, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. Sandra will invest in cement, sand, and laminate sheets so that she can improve her home and turn it into a place where she can live peacefully.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and laminate sheets so that she can improve her home.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a 53-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is a farmer who plants and harvests fruits and vegetables that he sells in their locality.

He aims to improve his farming business and earn sufficient income to sustain their necessities and finance the education of his youngest child. Having insufficient capital, he would like to avail himself of an additional PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

Being a hardworking father, he hopes that someday he will improve his farming and his business, as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Kinabuan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Fusi

texts.en:
Fusi is 25 years old. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Fusi has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, a container and butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profits. 

Fusi became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, a container and butter.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring shop in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring shop.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 53 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Enriqueta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Enriqueta has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from a fish vending business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 52 года, замужем, есть ребенок. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает буфетчицей в больнице.   С 1990 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 8 овец, 30 коз. Она получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 13,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Жылдызкан является лидером группы "Асылзат", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на строительство сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Zhyldyzkan is 52 and married with one child. She has a specialist high school education and works in food services at the hospital. Since 1990 she has also been working in farming as an additional source of income. She has eight sheep and 30 goats on her farm and receives a monthly income of about 13,000 KGS.

In order to further develop her business, Zhyldyzkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 90,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She is the leader of the Asylzat group, which consists of two other people besides herself. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm, and wants to save toward building a barn for her animals.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Nuraiym

texts.ru: Нурайым, 31 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. Нурайым в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Нурайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 30 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец и коровы для увеличения поголовья. Нурайым является участником группы "Ынтымак", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Нурайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nuraiym is 31 and married with three children. She works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 10 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has five cows and 30 sheep on her farm.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nuraiym has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 KGS to purchase five sheep and a cow to increase her head count. She is a member of the Intymak group, which consists of herself and three other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and into home renovations.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and one cow in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anarhan

texts.ru: Анархан, 39 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов, также с  2002 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 20 овец, 3 козы. Анархан получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Анархан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на строительство сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Anarhan is 39 and married with four children. She has a high school education and works selling fruits and vegetables. Since 2002 she has also worked in farming as an additional source of income. She has two cows, 20 sheep and three goats on her farm and receives a monthly income of about 10,000 KGS.

In order to further develop her farm, Anarhan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm, and wants to save toward building a barn for her animals.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her head count

loans.name: Rozagul

texts.ru: Розагул, 51 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. Розагул в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес 32 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Розагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения поголовья  скота и удоя экологически чистого молока. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Розагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Rozagul is 51 and married with two children. She works in animal husbandry as a source of income for her family, a business she began 32 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has five cows and five sheep on her farm.

With the goal of further developing her business, Rozagul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow to increase her head count and the amount of organic milk she can sell. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and into home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her herd and the volume of organic milk she can sell

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу, 62 года, замужем, есть сын. У Рысбубу - среднее образование. С 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая фасоль на 1,48 ГА собственной земли. Благодаря упорному труду Рысбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рысбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Rysbubu is 62 years old, married, and has a son. She has a secondary education, and has been practicing field and animal husbandry since 1995, growing beans on 1.48 hectares of her own land. Thanks to Rysbubu's hard work, her farm now has 2 cows, 1 horse, and 10 sheep. Her total monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Rysbubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. She will use the proceeds from her loan to add more livestock to her herd.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Seemoungkhounmeuang Group

texts.en:
See is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. See and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter See and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. See and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, See and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will provide for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lathngone Group

texts.en:
Thoumma’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Thoumma and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.

Thoumma and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years, filter users like Thoumma’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Idja Group

texts.fr: Bernadette, responsable du groupe a pu acheter la boisson pour vendre et faire un bénéfice qui lui a permis d'aider son époux dans la gestion de la famille. Bernadette remercie kiva pour le prêt.Le groupe de Bernadette a bien fait ses remboursements du premier crédit avec kiva et a besoin d'un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. Avec cet argent, Bernadette achetera la boisson pour vendre et elle pourra avoir un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire ses propres dépenses et continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Bernadette is the group representative. She will use her loan to buy drinks for sale and the profits will be used to help her husband provide for their family.

The group repaid their previous loan fully and on time and has now requested a second loan in order to continue with their businesses.

Bernadette is very grateful to the field partner for this loan which will allow her to cover her own expenses and continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale.

loans.name: Zhamilya

texts.ru: Жамиля, 42 года, замужем, есть ребенок. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает санитаром в больнице. С 1998 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 овец. Она получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жамиля планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Zhamilya is 42 years old, married and has a child. She has a specialized secondary education and works as an orderly at a hospital. To earn additional income, she has been involved in agriculture since 1998. Her farm contains 2 cows and 30 sheep. She earns a monthly profit in the amount of about 10,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Zhamilya plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal BENJAMIN HERMOZA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yanatile, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Hilario tiene 57 años de edad y tiene 01 hijo, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Hilario is a member of the Communal Bank “Benjamin Hermoza”, which is located in the District of Yanatile in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. He is 57 years old and has one child. Hilario divides his time between his daily activities and working in agriculture. He has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts forth into his work. Hilario wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost. Hilario is appreciative of the loan that has been issued and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Levaea

texts.en: Levaea is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. Levaea needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 35 years old, married and has two children attending school. They live in a rural community and earn their living through planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. He aimed to plant more fruits and vegetables, but he has limited capital. For this reason he is requesting for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his vegetable production. He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Kinabuan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea food to sell for her fish vending business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 61 год, вдова, есть 2 детей, у нее высшее образование, сейчас на пенсии. Батма известна как жизнерадостная, трудолюбивая и честная. Семья Батмы в 1974 году в поисках источника дохода, начала свой бизнес в сельском хозяйстве.  В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 2 коровы, 5 овец. На 0,23 Га собственной и 0,80 Га арендованной земли выращивает ячмень. на ежедневной основе продает молоко, экологически чистое и очень вкусное.  Ежемесячный доход Батмы 15,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на закупку коровы с теленком, для увеличения объемов удоя молока. Доходы от кредита Батма будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на постройку сараев.
texts.en: Batma is 61 years old, a widow and has 2 children. She has a college education and is currently retired. Batma is known as a happy, hardworking and honest person. In search of a source of income, Batma's family started their own agricultural business in 1974. Today her farm has 2 cows and 5 sheep. She grows barley on 0.23 hectares of her own and 0.80 hectares of leased land, sells ecologically clean and delicious milk on a daily basis. Batma's monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow with a calf in order to increase her milk volumes. Batma will invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business to save money for building barns.

loans.use: to buy a cow with a calf in order to increase her organic milk sales

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба, 29 лет, вдова, 2 детей, им 8 и 6 лет. У Насибы среднее образование, работает продавцом в магазине, также с 2005 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Она очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Насибы на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, на 0,50 Га земли выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Насибы  - около 12,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Насиба решила развивать ее бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Насиба хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Nasiba is 29 years old and a widow. She has 2 children, who are 8 and 6 years old. Nasiba has a secondary education, and works as a shopkeeper at a store. Since 2005 she has also worked raising animals and growing crops. She is very responsible and hard-working. Nasiba's farm currently has 2 cows, and she grows corn on 0.5 hectares of land. Nasiba's monthly income is around 12,000 som (KGS), which is not sufficient for a dignified life. 

Nasiba has decided to develop her business, so she approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. With the proceeds from her loan, Nasiba wants to further increase the number of livestock she has, which will allow her to increase the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Jesus Norberto

texts.es:
La venta y servicios de reparación de relojes es un negocio que ha ejercido el señor Jesús desde el año 2000 y que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de un amigo, y ahora es un experto con 15 años de experiencia en el mercado.

Gracias a su negocio el señor Jesús genera los ingresos para mantener a su familia, es todo un héroe para ellos, su hijo de 7 años todos los días, le espía su maleta esperando encontrar el dulce que lleva diariamente, Jesús es muy amable y amoroso con su familia.

Quiere solicitar el préstamo para invertirlo en repuesto de relojes, como pilas manillas, cristales, manecillas, también quiere comprar relojes en la estado para repararlos y posteriormente venderlos sacándoles buena utilidad.

Este préstamo le permitirá vender más, tener repuestos siempre a la mano y sacar mayor rentabilidad a la venta de relojes.
texts.en:
Jesús has run a watch sale and repair business since 2000. He learned this profession from a friend, and is now an expert with 15 years of experience in the trade. 

Thanks to his business, Jesús generates the income to provide for his family; to them he is a real hero. His 7-year-old son keeps an eye on his bag, looking out for the candy that is put in it every day. Jesús is very kind and affectionate towards his family. 

He is asking for a loan so he can buy watch parts such as batteries, hands, straps, watch glass and needles. He also wants to buy broken watches in order to repair them and then sell them on, putting them to good use. 

This loan will allow him to sell more, to always have spare parts to hand and to make more profit from his watch sales.

loans.use: to buy watch parts such as hands, straps, watch glass and needles, and to buy broken watches in order to repair them and make good use of them

loans.name: Joevy

texts.en:
Joevy is single and he works hard to support his family.

He has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice and vegetable vending businesses. Joevy is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to customers. Joevy has been sustaining his business activities through his past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Many of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world. Monica, 28, is based in the Kapsowar area of Kenya and is a mother. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming and when asked what is most enjoyable about her business, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Monica is very visionary and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling and selling dairy products. An improved income will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili is a 28-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Saili needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, a new grill, a gas bottle, and new tongs. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Saili has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, a new grill, a gas bottle and new tongs

loans.name: Asalia

texts.en:
Asalia is 48 years old with six children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has this experience for more than a year. 

Asalia need a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her business profit to support her family.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: La señora Julieta tiene una personalidad emprendedora. Su actividad principal es la confección y comercialización de polleras, la cual le genera su ingreso principal. Ella  tiene dos hijas que se dedican a estudiar y ayudar a su madre. Julieta trabajaba en el taller de una parroquia en la cual pagaba mensualmente la energía eléctrica y donde utilizaba maquinaria de costura alquilada para realizar su labor. Sin embargo, el taller en el que trabaja se vio forzado a cerrar, por lo cual vio la necesidad de adquirir una máquina de costura propia, para la cual solicitó un crédito. De esta manera, la Sra. Julieta logrará independizarse y trabajar a su propio ritmo, brindándole el tiempo necesario para salir adelante con mayor comodidad y sin descuidar a su familia. Paralelamente, también se dedica a la venta de las polleras que realiza, desplazándose a  comunidades en temporadas de ferias y fechas importantes ofreciendo y vendiendo su producto al público en general y haciendo lo que ama hacer.
texts.en:
Julieta has an enterprising personality. Her main occupation—and the one that generates her main income—is making and selling "polleras" (traditional Andean skirts). 

She has two daughters, who are devoted to going to school and helping her. 

Julieta used to work at the workshop of a parish church, where she used to pay for electricity on a monthly basis and where she used to work with rented sewing machines. 

However, the workshop was forced to close, and she saw the need to purchase her own sewing machine. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. 

With this purchase, Julieta will be able to become self-employed and work at her own pace, which will give her the time she needs to do well for herself in a more convenient way and without neglecting her family.

She also goes to other communities during festival season and important dates to offer the "polleras" she makes to the general public—an activity she loves to do.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to continue to work for the well-being of her family.

loans.name: Faye Gladys

texts.en:
Faye Gladys is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for business.

Faye Gladys has been in this business for 3 years. Faye Gladys earns more income from farming rice and raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Gladys, a smallholder dairy farmer in Kapletundi village in South Rift area of Kenya. Gladys is hardworking and committed to growth and expansion of her business. Her main income source is milk. However, this year she is focusing on something slightly different, horticultural farming.

Normally, horticultural farming complements dairy farming very well. Great farmers, like Gladys, are encouraged to do mixed farming in order to improve income levels and also cut costs. Gladys is seeking a KES 70,000 loan to venture into crop farming.

With your investment, Gladys will benefit from mixed farming in the following ways: She will make more income because she produces more products from her farm; she will cut costs by using byproducts from dairy, such as using cow dung for manure and using maize stalks as feed; she will manage risks by having different products coming out throughout the year.

loans.use: to grow crops.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a 42-year-old mother with one child. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years to earn a living. 

Miriama has requested for a loan to buy ttaro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Finauvale

texts.en:
Finauvale is a 45-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has four years with this business. 

Finauvale needs a loan to buy new  a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, petrol, tyres, and a new paint job. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Finauvale joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new  a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, petrol, tyres, and a new paint job

loans.name: Aigamanu

texts.en: Aigamanu is a 31-year-old unmarried woman with six children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Aigamanu needs a loan to buy plastic cups, cordials, sugar, a large spoon, Chinese candy, and a large cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Aigamanu has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, cordials, sugar, a large spoon, Chinese candy, and a large cooler

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members as well. 

Oliver is a poultry farmer, and she has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of chicken feed, chicks, and vaccines. 

Oliver also generates additional income from rental houses. She works from home 7 days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include poultry diseases. She is aspiring to build more rooms for her poultry. 

Oliver resides in her family house, and the family has access to both electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of chicken feed, chicks, and vaccines.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 35-year-old unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Ruta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ruta has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Genelie works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Genelie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a smallholder farmer who lives in Kamungei village in the South Rift area of Kenya. This 53-year-old lady has been doing dairy farming for very many years. Her main income source is milk. This year, however, she is seeking to venture into crop farming, which she will do alongside dairy farming. 

To get started is very expensive due to the high cost of farm inputs and labour. Lucky for her, she is a client of Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro-finance partner of Kiva's, bringing financial services closer to remote areas which are often neglected by mainstream financial institutions. Joice is seeking a loan to venture into horticultural farming. The loan amount will be used to pay for seeds, fertilizer and labour. Initial loan repayments will be afforded by income from the dairy section of her business.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming by paying for seeds, fertilizer and labour.

loans.name: Anushavan

texts.en:
Anushavan is a constructor from Ejmiatsin town. He lives with his father, wife and two children. It has already been 10 years since Anushavan first started providing construction work for the local people living in Ejmiatsin. 

He has applied for this loan to pay for the renovation of his car, and to purchase the tools and also materials needed for construction work (rotary hammer drill, cutting tool for tiles). The loan will be a big support for Anushavan, as the tools and materials that he currently uses are too old and need to be changed. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his car, and purchase the tools and materials needed for construction work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a widow with four children that she takes care for. She operates a retail shop in Kabalagala, a busy city suburb. Agnes' eldest daughter, cannot continue with her education do to a lack of tuition, so Agnes has opened up a business for her.

Agnes is a second-time borrower of the institution, and is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX. She has requested for this loan to buy two dryers, mirrors, steamers and a sink chair. These items will boost her daughter's business.

Agnes is thankful for the funders who help single mothers like her to support their families. Her future plan is to work hard and open up a retail shop for her second born, who is a 17 year old young man.

loans.use: to buy dryers, mirrors and a sink chair for her daughter's business.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
Bujar or ‘generous’ in English is a 45-year-old who dressed up for the photograph.  Note that in Albania people still consider the photograph as something special and thus they dress up in their best outfit. 

Bujar opened up a grocery store in his backyard about eight months ago and wants to stock up on inventory items for this store. His wife has been operating this store since the start because Bujar just started working for a distribution company in the city where they reside. 

Bujar is a married father of two children,18 and 12, with the oldest one planning to continue his studies in a public university.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for the grocery store that his wife started running about eight months back

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai is 20 years old and runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this more than a year. 

Salafai need  a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, a water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 33 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. 

Angelica needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, and a sack of rice. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Televise

texts.en:
Televise is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Televise needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, flippers, and a oxygen tank. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Televise has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, flippers, and a oxygen tank

loans.name: Perelini

texts.en:
Perelini is 21 years old and single. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Perelini has requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en: Ulata is an older mother; she is 71 years of age. She is still strong and fit in operating her business with the help of her seven children. She operates a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Ulata hopes to expand her business to gain more profit, but to do this she needs a loan. She will use the loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags to help with the business. Ulata became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags

loans.name: Mujahed

texts.en: Mujahed is a 26-year-old married man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and five kids in a small simple house. For the past five years, Mujahed has been working as a construction worker. This is the only source of income for the family. Mujahed would like to improve his business and expand it. Mujahed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his construction work. This will increase his productivity and also his income. Mujahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 61 years old, widowed with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like spices, noodles, soft drinks, spices, etc.

Estela  has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She  aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like spices, noodles, soft drinks, spices, etc

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Jane. She is a 51-year-old smallholder farmer based in Ndaragwa, which is a small rural town in the Central region of Kenya. Jane and her husband have been blessed with six children. 

For thirty years, Jane has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. 

Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Jane, however, is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. 

Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a smallholder farmer from Litein region of Kenya who is looking to do more crop farming on her land this year besides dairying. She owns a small piece of land in Kimolwet village where she keeps dairy cows and grows grass for fodder. 

Winny is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and labour that will go into planting cash crops on her farm. Initial loan repayments will be made through income generated from selling milk. Once the crops yield, her family stands to make enough income from produce sales to replant next year and take care of the current basic needs and educational expenses.

loans.use: to grow crops

loans.name: Khungnonglouang Group

texts.en:
Year’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Year and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Year and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Year’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Andoneta

texts.en:
This is Andoneta and her husband Nure. They are both in their 50s and are both receiving a disability pension. They have been photographed in front of their--let’s call it ‘home’--to which they want to make some repairs. They are villagers from the southeastern Albania and note that the rural areas in this region are much poorer compared to other regions. 

For the past 20 years, they have been pursuing agriculture planting, harvesting and selling in small quantities to acquaintances, yet mostly they use the products for themselves. Their village has a very cold climate and is located along the national road Tirana-Korca. This makes it easier for villagers to sell their products to passersby.  Andoneta and Nure are almost begging for your compassion and understanding.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to this home; they are extremely poor and the house in the background is proof of their living situation.

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur provides transportation service using his own car in Gladzor village of Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife and two-year-old son, Vardan. Bakur is the only breadwinner of his young family and works day and night to support his family's living. 

Among numerous problems that the family has, there is one that is the most urgent: the car that Bakur uses for providing transportation service is damaged and needs to be repaired. 

The requested loan will help Baur to pay for repair of the car and new tires to improve the car's working condition and continue providing transportation service. 

Bakur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for repair of the car and new tires, to  improve the car's working condition and continue providing transportation services

loans.name: Joweriya

texts.en:
Joweriya, 42, is an enterprising woman who wishes to obtain your support to boost her business.
