Susanna is a nurse from Gyumri town in Armenia, where she lives with her husband. She has provided a nursing service since 2010 and is well known in the town. She has requested this loan to buy medical equipment for nursing, which will help her to work more effectively. 
Susanna has now been approved for a loan through a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with good conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit.  
Susanna lives with her husband, who is 72 years old and receives a retirement pension. Her nursing income is very important for her family, so they are hoping for the support of lenders.

loans.use: to pay for medical equipment for nursing

loans.name: Jyambere Group

texts.en: Evaste is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married with two children aged between nine and 15 years, both of whom go to school. The group is called Jyambere, which means “Go Forward” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to improve their future. Evaste sells food and has been in this business for the past five years. Her husband is a business man as well. With the loan, Evaste would like to buy more beans and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beans and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Esulansi

texts.en:
Esulansi lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.

She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots and dried fish. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots and dried fish.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver lives with his family in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Nver has two children (school-aged). For many years untill today he has worked as a driver. His wife is a saleswoman at the wholesale market. Nver’s father also lives with them and he also works as a driver.

Nver has a great request and hopes not to be rejected. His beloved wife has some health problems and for its solution he needs financial support. He will urgently use this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) for the solution of his wife's health problems.

loans.use: for the solution of his wife's health problems.

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün is a 32-year-old single entrepreneur. Nilgün sells Farmasi brand cosmetics, which she was introduced to two years ago. Before selling the products, she began using them herself; since she was happy with the products, she kept ordering them. As people close to her heard about the cosmetics and started to place orders for them, Nilgün began making sales. In two years, she has always had customers who use these products.

With her third loan from Maya, she purchased merchandise wholesale, increased her commissions, and rose to a leadership position. As a hard-working and enterprising person, Nilgün wants to open a shop where she can sell her merchandise.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Nilgün 32 yaşında bekâr genç bir girişimci. Nilgün 2 yıl önce tanıştığı Farmasi marka kozmetik ürünlerini satıyor. Bu ürünleri satmadan önce kendisi kullanmaya başlıyor. Ürünlerden memnun kalınca sürekli sipariş vermeye başlıyor. Bu ürünleri duyan yakın çevresi de sipariş vermeye başlayınca Nilgün ürünlerin satışına başlıyor. 2 yılda bu ürünleri kullanan sürekli müşterileri oluşuyor. Maya'dan 3. kredisini kullanarak toptan ürün çekerek primini artırdı ve liderlik seviyesine ulaştı. Çalışkan ve girişken birisi olan Nilgün bu ürünlerin satışını yaptığı bir dükkân açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en: Yasemin is 44 years old, and working to put her children through school on her own.  She began making profiteroles 10 years ago.  She had cards and brochures printed to distribute and waited for orders.  When she didn’t get the response she had been hoping for, she began bringing her products to her customers.  She began selling different types of products as her sales increased.  She now sells savory pastries, stuffed grape leaves, cake and cookies from her newly opened store.  She will use her third loan from Maya to buy things she needs for her shop.

loans.use: to buy things she needs for her shop

loans.name: San Miguel Kuña Renda Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel Kuña Renda se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú con la unión de mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una hace la encuesta de los 50 indicadores para conocer mejor su situación de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sara quien vende prenda de todo tipo, es una persona que está saliendo adelante por su familia y por sus seres queridos. Ella quiere tener algún día, un negocio de venta propios, y que no tenga que vender más de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy entusiasta y es por ello que pone todo su entusiasmo para poder mejorar.
Sara quiere comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, ya que de esta manera podrá tener una mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called San Miguel Kuña Renda was formed in the city of Caaguazú, with a group of hard-working and determined women, all of them friends and neighbors in this city. They are part of the poverty elimination program where each of them completes the questionnaire of the 50 indicators to know each one's life situation better.  

One of the members is Sara, who works selling all sorts of clothing. She is a person who is getting ahead for her family and for her loved ones. She wants to one day have a business of her own sales, and not have to sell as a street vendor any more. She is a very enthusiastic woman and it is for this that she puts all of her enthusiasm toward being able to improve. 

Sara wants to purchase jerseys, jeans, shirts, pants and more, and with that be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing, since in this way she will be able to have a greater variety to be able to offer her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase jerseys, jeans, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Gloria Cecibel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene  31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Gloria es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para realizar su trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otras personas se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, salen en la tarde y regresan después de tres a cuatro días con los productos que el mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Ella por su parte en su casa también vende recargas y tarjetas telefónicas  con lo cual se gana algo extra y les sirven para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y recargas de teléfonos. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Urb. Las Viviendas meets every two weeks in Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and work in jobs related to the ocean. 

Gloria lives in this place. She is 31 years old, married, and in this relationship has two children, ages 10 and 8, both of whom go to school. Her husband works fishing.

Gloria is a great housewife who takes out the loan so that her husband has the necessary resources to do his work. Her husband works in fishing. He, along with other people, goes out to see in his small boat to do the work for fishing. They go out in the afternoon and come back after three or four days with the products that the sea gives them. Once they get to the beach, they sell their products to wholesalers so that they are distributed through the whole province. She, for her part, also sells minutes and phone cards at home, with which she earns something extra and it helps them get ahead. 

This loan is to purchase nets, string, fuel, and phone minutes. She has been in the communal bank group since the beginning and she likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her dream is to have a big boat for her husband to do the work of fishing.

loans.use: to purchase nets, strings, fuel, and phone minutes.

loans.name: Liliana Marita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 30 años de edad, está separada y vive sola dedicada a su trabajo que el que le permite salir adelante
Doña Liliana es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro y así forjarse su propio porvenir ella sola, ella tiene en su casa dos locales en uno ella surtió una confitería y en el otro un bar en el cual vende bocadillos, ella abre todos los días ambos locales y trabaja con la ayuda de una chica, como son dos locales cada uno requiere de mucha atención y más aun  los fines de semana que es cuando mas vende ya que llegan muchas personas al lugar,  lleva más de 10 años con su bar y 7 con la confitería negocios que de a poco ha ido mejorando y mas con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos hasta la fecha.
Este crédito es para comprar caramelos, golosinas y bebidas de toda clase para surtir sus negocios. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora sus negocios. Sus sueños seguir incrementado su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Urb. Las Viviendas meets every two weeks in Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and work in jobs related to the ocean. 

Liliana lives in this place. She is 30 years old, separated, and lives alone, working at her job with allows her to get ahead. Liliana is a woman who has had to work hard and in this way forge her future on her own. She has two retail spaces in her house. In one, she has established a candy shop and in the other a bar where she sells snacks. She opens both spaces every day and works with the help of one girl. Since there are two retail spaces, each one needs a lot of attention and even more on the weekends when she sells the most, since many people come to the place. She has had the bar for 10 years and the candy shop for 7, both businesses which have given her a little and she has been improving, and more with the help of the loans that she has gotten to date.  

This loan is to purchase hard candies, sweets, and drinks of all sorts to stock her businesses. She has been in the communal bank group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans improve her businesses. Her dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to purchase hard candies, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 3, es parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar y luchar por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian, quien vende frutas frescas y de estación, comenta que siempre tiene muy buena variedad de productos, y es lo que gusta a sus clientes, es por ello que le va muy bien y está creciendo poco a poco y va mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Lilian pide este préstamo para poder comprar manzanas, piñas, naranjas, peras, melones, bananas y otras frutas, y con ello poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes frutas frescas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante e ir luchando.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas is in its third loan cycle with the poverty elimination program, which allows them to know each one's situation and, according to that, be able to work and fight to improve each day. 

One of the members is Lilian who sells fresh seasonal fruits. She says that she always has a very good variety of products and that is what her customers like. For this, it is going very well for her and is growing little by little and is improving her quality of life and that of her family. 

Lilian asks for this loan to be able to purchase apples, pineapples, oranges, pears, melons, bananas and other fruits, and with that be able to continue offering her customers fresh fruit. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and continue fighting.

loans.use: to purchase apples, pineapples, oranges, pears, melons, bananas and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and carrots. Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to buy a plot of land. She lives in rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and carrots

loans.name: La Marca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo integrados por 4 personas activas, trabajadores y emprendedores, llevan el nombre de la ¨La Marca¨. Coordinados por Juan José, de 29 años, casado y con 5 hijos, quien orgullosamente se dedica a la venta en su carrito de hog dog, raspados y platanitos. Solicita el préstamo para ampliar y poder integrar nuevos productos como café, refrescos, chiverías y más. Con este financiamiento obtendrá mayores ganancias y poder ayudar más a su familia.
Sus miembros son; María Auxiliadora de 25 años dedicada a realizar y vender tamales; Justa Pastora de 42 años, tiene una pulpería y venden productos de granos básicos; Martha Cecilia de 23 años comerciante de Ropa Nueva destinadas para hombres y mujeres.
texts.en: This group is made up of 4 active, hard-working and enterprising people. They are called "La Marca." They are coordinated by Juan José, 29 years old, married with 5 children, who proudly works selling hot dogs, slush, and plantain chips from his cart. He asks for the loan to expand and be able to incorporate new products such as coffee, soft drinks, snacks and more. With this loan, he will get more earnings and be able to help his family more.  The members are María Auxiliadora, 25 years old, who works making and selling tamales, Justa Pastora, 42 years old, who has a grocery store and sells basic products, and Martha Cecilia, 23 years old, who sells new clothing for men and women.

loans.use: to expand and be able to incorporate new products such as coffee, soft drinks, snacks and more.

loans.name: Grethel Yaosca

texts.es: Grethel es una mujer emprendedora  exitosa tiene la edad de 25 años de edad, acompañada, y madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación, con el crédito anterior logro aumentar la oferta de productos y comprar vitrinas para guardar y mostrar los productos, solicita por sexta vez el financiamiento de Adim, ella es dueña de una tienda de variedades donde comercializa ropa y sandalias desde hace seis  años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, chores, faldas, vestidos y sandalias
texts.en: Grethel is a successful, enterprising woman who is 25 years old, partnered, and the mother of two children who are her desire to improve herself. With the last loan, she managed to increase the products she offers and to purchase display cases to keep and show the products. She asks for the sixth time for a loan from Adim. She is the owner of a variety store where she has sold clothing  and sandals for six years. The loan that she is requesting is to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders, meet Jeniffer. Jeniffer is a smallholder mixed farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town in the North Rift area of Kenya. She has been blessed with a lovely family. 

She has been a farmer for five years, producing milk, eggs and maize for both consumption and sale. Jeniffer's entrepreneurial spirit extends outside agriculture; she is involved in other personal businesses for extra income. 

Jeniffer is very ambitious. She enjoys making more and more returns but lacks lacking adequate capital puts her on a leash. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders for a loan. 

Jeniffer is seeking KES 11,350 to purchase a cow. With more cows, she will be able to utilize the pasture on her farm and increase milk production. Your loan will help Jeniffer to pull herself out of poverty through constantly growing her asset base. The cow you will finance will reproduce, and with time Jeniffer will produce many litres of milk and other dairy products. 

This improvement in her business will enable her to realize profits that are currently cut due to the high cost of inputs. It will impact the rest of her family in a very meaningful way.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aurora Suyen

texts.es: Aurora es una microempresaria emprendedora de 25 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 hijos por los que trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante, solicita por cuarta vez el financiamiento en Adim y se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos y ropa en desde hace cuatro años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, vanidades, sobras, brillos labiales y ropa por encargo.
texts.en: Aurora is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur, 25 years old, a single mother with 2 children for whom she works each day to get them ahead. She asks for her fourth loan from ADIM and has worked selling cosmetics and clothing for the past four years. The loan that she asks for will be to purchase perfumes, compacts, eye shadow, lipstick and clothing.

loans.use: perfumes, compacts, eye shadow, lipstick and clothing.

loans.name: Geysel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Geysel es una microempresaria emprendedora de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación, solicita por cuarta vez el financiamiento en Adim y se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos y ropa en desde hace cuatro años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, vanidades, sobras, brillos labiales y ropa por encargo.
texts.en: Geysel is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur, 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are her desire to improve herself. She asks for a loan from ADIM for the fourth time and works selling cosmetic and clothing, which she has done for four years. The requested loan will be to purchase perfumes, vanities, eye shadow, lipstick and clothing to order.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, vanities, eye shadow, lipstick and clothing to order.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina lives and works in her native city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Alina is married and now she lives with her husband, who because of his health problems is not able to work. Their two children are married and they live with their families. 

Alina used to work at the Kapan city’s fabric and starting in 2008 she established her own business; she is in a clothes trading business. Alina rents a stall at the wholesale market and she sells a great assortment of boys and girls clothes.  She brings her stall’s merchandise every month from Yerevan city in a rented car. She mentions she is thankful to her numerous regular customers; she manages to keep her business and also to gain new customers as well. 

This loan of 200,000 Armenian drams Alina thinks will be enough in order to refresh her stall’s spring-summer children clothes collection.

loans.use: to refresh her stall’s spring-summer children clothes collection

loans.name: Kiymet

texts.en:
Klymet is married and is the mother of two children, ages 10 and 7. For 16 years she sold knitting, lingerie, and hosiery from her home.  For the last two years she has continued to sell these items from a small stand in the market.  With the three loans she has received from Maya, Klymet has increased the variety of products she sells from her stand and has increased her potential customers.  

As someone with a hardworking and productive personality, Klymet wants to open a shop where she can sell her merchandise in the future, and to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Kıymet evli ve biri 10 diğeri 7 yaşında 2 çocuk annesi. 16 yıl boyunca evde örgü, çamaşır ve çorap satmış.  Son iki yıldır pazardaki küçük tezgâhında bu satışlara devam ediyor.  Mayadan 3. kredisini kullanan Kıymet hanım aldığı krediler ile tezgâhında ki ürün çeşitliliğini artırdı ve daha çok müşteri potansiyeline sahip oldu.  Çalışkan ve üretken bir kişiliğe sahip olan Kıymet gelecekte bir dükkân açarak ürünlerini burada satmak ve çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes and his family run a small production of soft drinks in the town of Gyumri. They organize the production in a small garage near their house, and sell produced soft drinks in the local stores of Gyumri. Hovhannes, his parents and his brother are intensively involved in soft drinks production and are working hard to develop and expand their family business. The only thing the family now needs is some financial support to invest in their business. Hovhannes requests this loan to purchase equipment, materials and tools for soft drinks production.
 
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
 
This hard-working young businessman and his family hope to receive lenders' support and make an investment in their soft drinks production.

loans.use: to pay for equipment, materials and tools for soft drinks production

loans.name: Serap

texts.en:
Serap is married and has one child.  For 11 years, she has set up stands at tourist sites, where she has sold knitted items and jewelry that she makes herself to domestic and foreign tourists; in this way, she has helped support her family.  When she first got into this business, she had a lot of difficulties, because she didn’t know how to do this kind of work.  In order to develop her jewelry-making skills and to learn the work better, she went to live for awhile with her family.  With her loans from Maya, she has bought jewelry materials and thereby increased her product range.  With her third loan from Maya, she is preparing to open the jewelry store of her dreams.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Serap evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  On yıldır turistik mekânlar da açtığı stantlarda yerli ve yabancı turistlere kendi yaptığı örgü ve takıları satarak ailesinin geçimine destek oluyor.  Bu işe başladığında takı yapımında çok zorluklar yaşadı çünkü bu işi bilmiyordu.  Takı işinde kendisini geliştirmek ve bu işi öğrenmek için ailesinin yanına gitti.  Mayadan aldığı kredilerle takı malzemesi alarak ürün çeşidini artırdı.  Maya’dan aldığı 3. kredi ile hayalini kurduğu takı dükkanını açmaya hazırlanıyor.

loans.use: to open a jewelry store

loans.name: Mehar  Unnisa

texts.en:
At the age of 50, Mehar Unnisa deals in a business of livestock. Her husband, also shown in the photo assists her in buying and selling goats. She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Mehar Unnisa has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for purchasing more goats to sell in the market at a profit for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market at a profit for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz, age 49, is a married woman with three children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo.  Four years ago, she decided to support her family by stitching clothes at her home. She has an income that is barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Gulnaz is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she faces difficulty in covering daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine along with thread, buttons and lace to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with thread, buttons and lace to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. 

She has been doing a business of livestock sale and purchase for many years with the support of her husband. She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Hameeda has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more livestock for reselling in the market to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for reselling in the market for providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is 54 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a barber by profession. He is known in his town for doing good hair styling and cutting. He makes enough to contribute in the family income. 

Now, he needs to serve more customers, time after time. For this reason Dilshad has obtained a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR, for her son. It enabled him to purchase more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with some furniture for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of hair scissors, brushes and combs, along with some furniture for his shop.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 58-year-old married woman. She is shown in the photo with her son. She has been in the business of animal sales and purchases for many years. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. She currently has a few goats. Now, Parveen has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000, which she used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) some time ago started a van driving business. Her husband owns one van and needs some financial help. He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van to provide better services. Therefore, Rukhsana has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of a van to provide better services.

loans.name: Dhumdada Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Nasimbanu, 29, is the leader of this group of borrowers from Dahod district in India’s western border state of Gujarat. She is pictured standing in the centre of the above group. 

Nasimbanu is the proprietor of a petty store, a neighborhood convenience store that sells household necessities. Ghee, packaged tea, cleaning acid, phenyl and incense sticks (agarbattis) are among the items she stocks for regular sale at her store.

She wants to expand her small-scale business, as the store has the potential to earn at least INR 6,000 a month, significantly more than the INR 4,000 that she currently earns. Obtaining credit for expansion is challenging because it is mostly available from local moneylenders who charge exorbitant interest rates. A crowd-funded micro loan, on the other hand, will give her the space to expand without the crushing burden of debt. The capital raised from the loan will help Nasimbanu boost her inventory of items currently sold at the petty store. The increased savings from greater sales will mean better education and an improved standard of living for her children and family. 

Samsad and Rahemin, who run a retail fruit micro enterprise; Saidabanu, who retails vegetables, and Gayatriben who runs a small-scale business in selling textiles are the other members of this group. These women seek a joint loan of INR 75,000 to fund the expansion of their small-scale businesses. 

The loan will be administered by Prayas, a local organization that helps connect local women entrepreneurs with sources of credit on fair terms. Nasimbanu extends her deep gratitude for the faith and goodwill you have shown in funding her micro loan.

loans.use: To boost her petty store's inventory of ghee, tea, cleaning acid and incense sticks.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has six children. 

Her husband has been doing a business selling crockery for many years. He offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Nazia contacted Kashf Foundation and availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. In this way her husband was able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, glasses and plates in various sizes and designs. He expects a boost in his net income.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, glasses and plates in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is married and has two children. Her daughter was married two years ago. Today Dilara lives with her husband, her son and his bride. She has a lovely grandchild. Her son is a taxi driver. They live in the Fuzuli region, but over the 22 years they are IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city.

She has a small store where she sells cleaning products. Today Dilara wants to support her business and therefore she has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to buy products (soaps, washing powders, cleaners, etc.) to support the development of her business. She says thanks to the Kiva organization for aid. 

In the future Dilara wants to repair the store.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 48-yr-old Ramatu. She is married and has 3 children, who are 26, 17, and 13 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her as a sales assistant.  

In 1996, Ramatu established her plastics sales business. Because of low sales in plastic, she decided to change her business to selling rice by the bag.  She began her business because she wants to help take care of her home and family. By working 6 days per week and 15 hours per day, she is able to earn approximately 1,000,000 SLL every month from her business. 

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ramatu would like this loan in order to buy thirty (30) more bags of rice for resale. In the future, Ramatu still plans to build a house and to educate her children to the university level.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 30 bags of rice for resale

loans.name: Tierra Prometida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tierra Prometida está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., son 24 mujeres todas ellas jefas de familia, muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra, quien se dedica a la elaboración de Postres y decoraciones en general. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su sacrificio diario viene mejorando cada día para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesita para una vida digna.
La Sra. Sandra solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materia prima para sus postres, como harina, dulce de leche, dulce de guayaba, huevos, entre otras cosas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The group Tierra Prometida is in its third loan cycle in the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are 24 women, all of them heads of family, very hard-working, and determined. 

One of the members is Sandra, who works making desserts and general decorations. Through her efforts and ongoing work, and through her daily sacrifice,she has been improving each day to be able to give her family all it needs for a respectable life. 

Sandra asks for this loan to purchase raw materials for her desserts such as flour, dulce de leche, sweet guava paste, eggs, and others. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for desserts such as flour, dulce de leche, sweet guava paste, eggs, and others.

loans.name: Olinda Pilar

texts.es: Olinda es una joven soltera de 28 años de edad, estudia tecnología medica hace un año,labora como técnica en un laboratorio clínico, su sueño es terminar cuanto antes de estudiar y trabajar en un hospital reconocido,por el cual solicito el préstamo a Edaprospo para poder pagar las mensualidades  y materiales que le exigen ya que el costo es muy alto,Olinda se siente muy agradecida con Kiva por la ayuda brindada ya que lo económico era un obstáculo muy difícil de solucionar y salir adelante."Gracias Kiva por la ayuda que me das a pesar de no conocerme" ojala y hubiesen muchas personas como ustedes les prometo que no los voy a defraudar.
texts.en: Olinda is a single young woman, 28 years old. She has been studying medical technology for a year and works as a technician at a clinical lab. Her dream is to finish her schooling as soon as possible and work at a well-known hospital, so she has asked Edaprospo for a loan to be able to pay the monthly fees and the materials that she needs, since the cost is very high. Olinda is grateful to Kiva for the help offered since the economic situation was an obstacle very difficult to solve to get ahead. "Thank you Kiva for the help that you have given me despite not knowing me. If only there were many people like you. I promise that I will not disappoint you."

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 31, comes from a lush farming location known as Chesoi in Kapsowar, Kenya. Here, both crops and animals thrive in the hot wet weather. Jane owns a small parcel of land where she grows maize among other crops and keeps dairy animals. Today, she is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional dairy cow. The newly-acquired cow will help utilize pasture and maize stalks in her farmland. The cow will also increase the quantity of milk that Jane sells to her neighbours and to the local market. Income from this investment will be a great booster in her personal and business life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Armenak

texts.en:
Armenak is a hardworking young man from Kapan town, Syunik region. He lives with his mother and 7-year-old brother. 

As the main breadwinner of the family, Armenak has to work hard to cover daily living costs. He is a construction worker with three years of working experience. Realizing that the income gathered from construction work only is not enough for the family's living, he also started providing a taxi service, using his own car. 

Now, working at nights as a taxi driver and the rest of the day as construction worker gives Armenak an opportunity to sustain his family with normal living conditions. 

The only thing Armenak now asks is some financial means to invest on his construction work. He asks lenders to support him in purchasing tools (drill, rotary hammer drill). 

Armenak  has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools (drill, rotary hammer drill) for providing construction work and earning income for the family's living

loans.name: Suna

texts.en:
Suna is married and has two children. She makes jewelry and scarves at her home. She sells to her friends and neighbors as well as at stands. 

Suna, who makes her own designs, is taking her second loan from Maya. 

She’ll use the loan to buy jewelry-making materials, beads and fabric. Suna’s goal is to open a jewelry workshop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Suna Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Evinde takı ve fular tasarımı yapıyor. Bu ürünlerinin satışını çevresine ve stantlarda yapıyor. Kendine ait tasarımları olan Suna Hanım Maya’dan 2. kredisini kullanıyor. Kredilerini takı malzemesi, boncuk ve kumaş alarak değerlendirdi. Suna Hanımın hedefi takı tasarım atölyesi açmak

loans.use: to buy jewelry-making materials

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is a technician specialist living in Koghb village of Tavush region. He has been involved in renovation of computer and other technical devices for six years. Over those years of hard work, Mher was able to have a number of loyal clients and is already well-known in the village as a good specialist.
 
To be able to improve the quality of work he provides, Mher applied for this loan. He asks lenders to support him to purchase tools and materials for providing computer and technical equipment renovation service. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing computer and technical equipment renovation service

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
Serpil is a married mother of two.  Serpil is working as a hairdresser, starting out with a very tiny spot.  Over time, as she gained more customers, she was able to open a larger space.  

Currently, Serpil not only runs her own salon, but also works as a qualified instructor, training hairdressers like herself.  

Serpil is now on her third loan from Maya.  By purchasing hair dye wholesale with the loans she has received from Maya, she has increased her profits.  

Serpil is a hardworking and determined person, and her biggest dream is to open a larger salon.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Serpil evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Serpil hanım kendi kuaför dükkânın da çalışıyor.  Önce çok küçük bir dükkânla işe başlamış.  Zaman içinde müşteri sayısı artınca daha büyük bir dükkân açmış.  Şu an Serpil hem kendi dükkanını işletiyor hem de bu dükkanda usta öğreticilik yaparak kendi gibi kuaförler yetiştiriyor.  Serpil Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanıyor. Maya’dan kullandığı krediler ile toptan saç boyası alarak karını artırıyor.  Çalışkan ve azimli bir yapıya sahip olan Serpil hanımın en büyük hayali daha büyük bir dükkân açmak.

loans.use: to buy hair dye

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 30 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has two children and is married. 

As a group leader, Everlyne is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Everlyne's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Everlyne and her group will receive a total of 11 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 21-year-old, married lady with two children. Her husband (who is also shown in the photo) is a tailor by profession. He has been providing the service of stitching clothes in his locality. Over the years, he has established a good clientele. 

Samina has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. It will allow him to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. She expects a boost in her husband's income and dreams of having a good quality life.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
At the age of 55, Rukhsana deals in a business of livestock. Her husband, also shown in the photo, fully supports her. She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Rukhsana has availed herself a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one buffalo. It will increase her profits  for providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is the group leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing 14 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of three children. Emily joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Emily decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Emily's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 11 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights, as, even though Emily decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Ruta's Group

texts.en:
Ruta, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is 47 years old and a married mother of six children, often described as a very reliable person. 

Although Ruta has been a farmer for more than 30 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Ruta wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Ruta hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights, as, even though Ruta decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh is a 47-year-old married woman. Some years ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Currently, Farrukh has requested a Murabaha of 30,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Gul  Shifa

texts.en:
Gul Shifa is a 54-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She sells milk to the people of her locality. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Violla

texts.en: The person appearing in the photo is Violla, who is 36 years old and the mother of four children. She has been doing dairy and vegetable farming for the past three years. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 and acquired skills and knowledge on how to expand and manage her business in order to increase her income that will support her children's education. Violla plans to use the loan she is borrowing to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and also to buy chickens to start poultry-keeping. She looks forward to more profits from improved farming. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and help.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and to buy chickens to start poultry farming.

loans.name: Weseiyo Women Group

texts.en:
Dorcas, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Weseiyo Women Group. She is 26 years old, with four children who are in primary school. She is married and lives with her four children. 

She runs a business of vegetable  farming. She is taking a loan to purchase farming inputs, e.g. seeds and fertilizer. 

She hopes that her business will go well, thus enable her to increase her level of income. This will assist her in providing food and paying school fees for her children. 

Dorcas is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to help boost income from improved farming..

loans.name: Weseiyo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Pascaline, a member of Weseiyo Women Group. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with four children. Pascaline lives with her husband and her four children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training courses on financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management and she is able to expand her kiosk business through proper recording keeping and prudent financial management.

Pascaline is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock of foodstuff to her kiosk. This will lead to more income from boosted sales that she will use to educate her children and also provide them with enough food and clothing.

She appreciates the Kiva support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of foodstuffs for the kiosk that will boost sales, thus more income.

loans.name: Kibriyo

texts.en:
Kibriyo is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in a small village near the beautiful hills. She is married and eight children. 

She has a big family, and to feed them is not easy. She is a cleaning woman and has three years practice of her activity in a secondary school. Also she has a milk cow and sells milk and yogurt to people. 

She wants to buy plastic doors and windows for her house, and warming items. There are no windows and doors in her house, and that is why in the winter season they have problems of keeping the house warm. 

She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy warmer items and plastic doors and windows because she wants to be prepared before winter comes. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy plastic doors and windows to her house and warming items

loans.name: Ishlampura Mahila Mandal- 2 Group

texts.en:
This group of five borrowers is led by Samabibi. The members are residents of Dahod district in the western Indian state of Gujarat. Samabibi, 29, is pictured standing in the middle of the group. 

Samabibi owns and operates an ice cart, a small-scale business that sees a major uptick in business during the summer. Ice lollies, ice-cream bars, cold sherbet and chilled soda are among the items she stocks in her cart. This micro business helps her earn about INR 3,000 in a month. With the infusion of a little capital, she will be able to stock additional quantities of the items she sells and also offer her customers a greater variety of cold treats. Samabibi expects to see an increased income of INR 5,000 and hopes to save more money for the education of her three children. She believes that a holistic education is the best asset she can leave behind for her children.

Faridaben, Amirbibi, Kanijabibi and Dituben are the other members of this group. They own and operate petty stores that sell household conveniences. Samabibi and her group collectively seek a loan of INR 70,000 to fund the expansion of their small-scale businesses. The loan amount will help them purchase fresh stocks of goods for their businesses. The increased income will guarantee a better education for their children and an improved standard of living for their families in the long run. 

The loan will be disbursed and administered by Prayas, an organization that helps rural women entrepreneurs expand the scale of their operations by improving their entrepreneurial and marketing skills, and helping them access credit on fair terms. 

Samabibi and her group thank you profusely for the faith and encouragement you have shown them by helping fund their loan.

loans.use: To stock more cold treats for her ice-cart micro-enterprise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and more.

loans.name: Yomaira Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Yomaira,  tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica local.
Doña Yomaira para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días ya que sale y vende en su casa, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en Guayaquil cuando puede. Tiene más de 2  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que les ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas credit group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are very hardworking and work in fishing activities. 

This is where Yomaira lives. She is 19 years old, She is married and from that relationship she has a 2 year old daughter. Her husband works in a local factory. In order to help with the household expenses, Yomaira sells all types of clothing. She sells door to door and also from her home, where her customers can go to buy her products. She works every day because she goes out and sells from home. She sells on credit to her customers and collects in two payments. She buys her merchandise in Manta or in Guayaquil whens he can. She has been doing this activity more than 2 years, and she earns something that helps them get ahead.  

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the credit group for 2 years and she likes it because thanks to her first loan she started her business. Her dream is to give her baby the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rocio Lourdes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Rocío, tiene  41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 20 y 16 años, ambos estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Rocio es una mujer que le gusta ganar sus propios ingresos con su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  sale tres  o cuatro veces por semana y no tiene horarios fijos, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan de alguna prenda, ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que así se gana algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas credit group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are very hardworking and work in fishing activities.    

This is where Rocío lives. She is 41 years old, married and has two children, aged 20 and 16. They are in college and high school. Her husband is a fisherman.  

Rocio is a woman who likes to earn her own income with her work. She sells all types of clothing. She sells door to door, going out three or four times a week with no set schedule. She sells on credit and collects every week. She also sells from her house if her customers need an item of clothing. She started her business with the first loan the group received. She is very grateful because this way, she earns something on her own.   

She is going to use the loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because thanks to it she started her business. Her dream is for her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shits, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other family members. 

She has been selling Irish potatoes at the market for the last three years, working seven days a week. She has requested for a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes and boxes of tomatoes and onions for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Her dream is to buy a delivery van to help with transportation. She lives in a rented house with no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bag of Irish potatoes and boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Mirella Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirella, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mirella es una mujer que le gusta generar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, ella desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale cuatro vences por semana en la mañana o en horas de la noche ya que a esta hora es más fresco y puede encontrar a sus clientes para vender o cobrar ya que les deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  ropa de niños que es lo que más vende. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños darles la mejor educación a su hijos.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas credit group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. It is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are very hardworking and work in activities related to fishing.  

This is where Mirella lives. She is 35 years old, married and from her marriage has 3 children, aged 17, 15 and 9. Her children are in college, high school and elementary school. 

Mirella is a woman who likes to generate her own income and with it help her family get ahead. She has sold every type of clothing for 8 years. She sells door to door. going out four times a week or at night when it is cooler and she can find customers to sell to or collect from, since she sells on credit and collects weekly. 

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing, which is what she sells the most. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lourdes Jessenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tienen 3 hijos de 21, 16  y 6 años de edad, los dos menores  estudian en colegio y escuela.
Doña Lourdes para salir adelante  con los gastos del hogar y para darles a sus hijos lo necesario para vivir ya que ella es padre y madre a la vez  se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa en la cual vende ropa de todo tipo, ella trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones cuando sus hijos pueden estar en el negocio ella también sale vender  puerta a puerta sus prendas. Gracias a sus ganancias ella puede sacar adelante a sus hijos ella  sola.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Lleva casi 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella. Sus sueños es que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are very hard-working and work in fishing activities.

Lourdes, age 40, lives here.  Her husband died several years ago, but they had three children, ages 21, 16, and 6.  The two youngest go to high school and elementary school.

In order to get ahead with the household expenses and to give her children what they need to get ahead, Lourdes, because she is both mother and father to her children, has a place at her house where she sells all types of clothes.  She works every day, and sometimes, when her children are able to stay with the business, she also sells her garments door to door.

Thanks to her earnings she is able to get her children ahead by herself.

She will use the loan to buy pants, shirts, and children’s clothes.  She has been in her communal bank for almost two years.  She likes it because the loans are very important to her.  Her dream is that her children will never have to do without anything.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is 31 years old and earns a living by farming in the mountainous Kapsowar region. She has been married for 10 years to her husband and they have lovely children together. 

After getting married, Dorcus immediately started to make use of her husband’s farm to grow crops (e.g., maize) and raise animals (cattle). Dorcus is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies that will allow her to grow maize faster and easier. 

Besides maize farming, Dorcus also keeps dairy cows and poultry. The additional income generated by this investment will allow her to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He is 49 years old and a married father of 6 children. He is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although David has been a farmer for more than 20 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, David wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, David hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights, as, even though David decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Leyda Cecilia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Leyda, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno vive con ellos y estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Leyda  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, entre otras cosas, a pesar de que su tienda no tiene mucho tiempo la tiene bien surtida y  sus clientes consiguen de todo,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  tiene dos años en su negocio el cual lo mejora cada vez más con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres y unas vitrinas para vender artículos de bazar también. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are very hard-working and work in fishing activities.

Leyda, age 45, lives here.  She is married, and they have four grown children.  One of the children lives with them and goes to school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Leyda has a grocery store at her house.  She sells products like rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, vegetables, and meat, among other things.  In spite of the fact that she has not had her store for very long, it is well-stocked, and her customers get everything there.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Sometimes she works later.  She has had the business for two years.  She improves it more each time with the loans.

She will use this loan to buy supplies and a display case to also sell general merchandise.  She has been in her communal bank for three cycles.  She likes it because of the help that the institution provides.  Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and display cases.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 37 years old and a married mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has benefited from the enterprise development training whereby she has been able to commercialize her farming.

Jackline practices livestock farming where she keeps dairy cows and goats. She is taking this loan to buy animal feed which will enable her to increase production of milk - hence realizing more sales by meeting her customer's demands.

She is grateful to Kiva for the financial support given.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Paul is representing his group of ten farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Paul's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Paul and his group will receive a total of five solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an irrigation kit.

loans.name: Phonsong Group

texts.en:
Pean understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Pean knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Pean purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Pean is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kiseveni Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Everlyin, a member of Kiseveni Women Group. She is a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand in 2013 with the aim of benefiting from the trainings, especially on enterprise development.

Everlyin does poultry keeping. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chickens so as to add stock to her poultry business and hence be able to satisfy her customers' demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chickens so as to add stock to her poultry business and hence be able to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of assorted  drinks

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is 39 years old and a married mother of 5 children, often described as a very hardworking individual.

Although Carolyne has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Carolyne wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Carolyne hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 7 solar lights, as, even though Carolyne decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Selina, sixty three years old and blessed with eight children. She practices maize, beans and potato farming.

Selina joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013 and she is grateful for the Enterprise training. She is applying for a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers to use during planting season which in turn will boost her crop. She hopes this will help improve her crop production thus generating more income that will enable her to be in a position to meet her family needs such as food and education.

Selina is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to help boost crop production and thus be in a position to provide for her family's needs.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 33 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Hellen is representing her group of 16 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Hellen's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Hellen and her group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as loans for inputs for maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 9 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jenny Gricelda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive a la señora Jenny, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 13 y 11 años de edad, tres estudian en  colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Jenny es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudar con los gastos que representan los estudios de sus hijos, ella en su casa tiene un deposito que vende agua en  bidones o galones, colas, cervezas, entre otras bebidas, también entregan a domicilio en una tricimoto que tiene, para esto le ayudan sus hijos y su marido cuando está desocupado de sus labores. Lleva 2 años con este negocio el cual le deja muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidones y en todas las variedades. Esta desde el inicio en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for it's beautiful beaches and the majority of inhabitants are very hard-working and work related to the sea.

Jenny lives in this place. She is 32 years old, married and from this relationship has 4 children aged 16,15 13 and 11 years old. Three of them study in Secondary school and one in primary school. Her husband is a businessman.

Jenny is a woman who has always liked to work to help with the expenses for the education of her children. She has a store at her house where she sells water in barrels or gallon containers, colas and beer amongst other drinks. She also delivers to homes with a three wheeled motorcycle she has. Her children help her with this as does her husband when he is not working.

She has been in this business for 2 years and she makes good profit. She will use the loan to buy plastic jerry cans of water and all the other varieties. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it because of the help the loans provide. Her dream is to continue to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy water.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Hellen operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy pineapples, watermelon, oranges, tomatoes, onions, and green bananas. 

Hellen's major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van to ease transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, pineapples, watermelon, oranges

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Kadie. She is married, and has 3 children aged 14, 10 and an 18 month old baby. Two of them go to school. In 2005, Kadie established her food stuff business (milk, vegetable oil, sardine etc.). Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 3,645,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000.

Kadie has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of soft drinks, and bundles of pure water, cartons of milk, sardines etc for resale. In the future, Kadie still plans to continue asking for subsequent loans and to grow her business and open another outlet.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of soft drinks, and bundles of pure water.

loans.name: Carmen Yessenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 12 y 5  años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Carmen con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y  para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, toallas, entre otras cosas, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos puerta a puerta  aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza por pedidos. Trabaja todos los días, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 2 años  en esta actividad que le sirve para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, sabanas, toallas, entre otras cosas que vende. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Las Viviendas Urban Credit Group gathers every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, and place known for its gorgeous beaches. Here the majority of residents are very hardworking and dedicated to working by the sea. This is where Carmen lives. She is 35 years old, and is in a domestic partnership with three children of ages 13, 12, and 5. Her children attend elementary and middle school, and her husband is a fisherman.

In order to grow and to have her own income to depend on, Carmen makes a living selling clothing, sheets, towels, and other items. She goes door-to-door selling her product, but the majority of her sales are made by order. She works every day, allowing her customers to purchase her products on credit and pay her back over one to two weeks as needed. She has been doing this work for two years, and it helps her to keep moving forward.

Carmen is going to use this loan to buy clothing, sheets, towels, and other sales items. She is just starting with this Credit Group, and she likes the benefits and other loans it offers. Her dream is to continue forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets, towels, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a smallholder dairy farmer from the Songhor area in Kenya. She has been married for 12 years to her husband and together they have three children. 

Emily started farming on her spouse's 2.5 acre farm soon after their marriage. Today, she keeps three dairy cows and 25 head of poultry. When asked during appraisal how many trees were on the farm, she simply said, "Too many." 

Emily is seeking loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a chaff cutter. To Emily, and most dairy farmers, the quality of hay is essential to keeping the cows healthy and productive. With your loan, the chaff cutting machine will bring the following economic benefits to Emily:  reduced wastage of fodder, and trace elements and other additives that boost milk production can be easily mixed with chaff. 

Additional income from this investment will go towards educating her two children in school and raising her last born who is only one year old.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Zainab H.

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Zainab H. She is married and has three children, aged 10, 8, and 8 months; two are school-going children. 

In 2004, Zainab H. established her clothing, textiles and tailoring accessories business. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 3,900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. Zainab H. has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of quality printed cotton and linen fabrics. 

In the future, Zainab H. plans to concentrate on improving her business, which will help her to take a big step in her business. She has introduced another product (slippers) due to the demand of her customers. She thanks you for your support.
