loans.use: to buy bales of quality printed cotton and linen fabrics.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
The sunny woman in the photo is Karine, from Ditavan village. She is a farmer and lives with her husband and 24-year-old son. Karine's farm is not big but due to her hard work, it is sustainable and profitable enough to provide the family with a monthly income. Karine keeps two calves, some hens and cultivates a big variety of vegetables and fruits (wheat, corn, haricots, grass) on the farm. Karine's husband helps her to sell the gathered harvest in the market, and this is main source of income for the family.

Karine has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful, she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan. Karine has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Karine and her family members hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets and seeds for land cultivation to improve the farm and gather more income for the family

loans.name: George's Group

texts.en:
George is a 60-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, George has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

George described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, George’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bricks and stones to set a house foundation.

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
Naomi is the group leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing 14 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Naomi joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Naomi decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits that she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Naomi's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights, as, even though Naomi decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom are attending school. She has no additional family members.

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her challenges include the seasonality of food. Her dream is to expand her business so as to serve more customers. 

She joined MCDT because of the successful members of her community who are members of the SACCO.

She resides in her own house with access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, es propietario de un taller de motocicletas así mismo ofrece sus debidos repuestos, tiene casa propia y la comparte con sus esposa e hijo, tiene varios años de dedicarse a dicho negocio y hasta la fecha no representa dificultades para continuar trabajando.
Invertirá en aceite, cadenas, llantas, parches y otros repuestos para reparar motocicletas, será de ayuda para dar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, procurará utilizar de la mejor manera el capital para generar mejores ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son que las ventas aumenten para que su situación financiera sea más favorable y pueda cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Roberto owns a motorcycle shop where he offers necessary repairs. He has his own house where he lives with his wife and son. He has spent several years working at this business, and up to the present has had no problems that would keep him from continuing working. 
He will invest in oil, chains, tires, patches and other spare parts to repair motorcycles, this will help him offer high quality service to his customers. He will try to use his capital in the best way to generate more income. 
He hopes his sales will grow, so his financial situation will improve and he can meet all his obligations.

loans.use: to invest in oil, chains, tires, patches, and other spare parts to repair motorcycles, this will help him to offer high quality service to his customers

loans.name: Baranaba's Group

texts.en:
Baranaba, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He is 47 years old and a married father of six children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Baranaba has been a farmer for more than 20 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Even though he is new to the program, Baranaba wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Baranaba hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights, as, even though Baranaba decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Osman. He is married and has three children, aged 12, 8 and 1; one is a school-going child. He has two additional dependents who live with him and are relatives to be fostered.  

In 2012, Osman established his suitcase and bags business. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 4,774,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Osman has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase sets of suitcases and dozens of school bags. 

In the future, Osman plans to complete his unfinished building and purchase a commercial bike. He commented that the previous loans have made good improvement in his life, and he hopes to acquire more loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sets of suitcases and dozens of school bags.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 28-year-old smallholder farmer who lives with her husband at Chesoi village in North Rift, Kenya. Agnes owns 1 acre of lush farmland, where she keeps dairy cows and poultry. Milk is her family's main source of income. 

Agnes is respectfully applying for a KES 42,400 loan for a dairy cow. The additional cow will increase her farm's milk production volume by an estimated 50 percent. The extra money that she stands to make from this investment will be channeled toward her younger children's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
This is Mamusu. She is married and has five children, aged 28, 25, 21, 18 and 8 years; two are school-going children. 

In 2002, Mamusu established her drinks, beverages and local produce (beans and palm oil) business. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,792,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mamusu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of provisions and gallons of palm oil. 

In the future, Mamusu plans to purchase more goods and acquire a large store to display her business. Mamusu has introduced another product (local foodstuff) in her business that has made great improvement. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and acquire a large store to display her business.

loans.name: Gladys Lorena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos de 17, 14, 13, 10, 9 y 8 años de edad, los seis menores estudian  en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Gladys es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para el bien familia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas, plomos, arpones, entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, tiene un local en su casa en el cual sus clientes encuentran todos estos productos,  trabaja todos los días, cada quince días viaja hasta el centro de Manta a comprar lo necesario para que cuando lleguen sus clientes tener de todo para ellos, lleva 3 años en  esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, entre otros productos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó este negocio. Sus sueños son comprar una lancha para la pesca.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Jaramijo. It is known for it's beautiful beaches and the majority of it's inhabitants work in activities related to the sea.

Gladys lives here. She is 36 years old, married and has 6 children aged 17, 14, 13, 10, 9 and 8 years old. They all study in Secondary and Primary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Gladys is a woman who likes to earn her own way and make her own income for the good of her family. She has a business selling fishing supplies such as nets, hooks, rope, lead, harpoons, amongst many other things that are required to fish in the high seas. She has a store at her house where her clients can find all these products. She works every day and travels t the center of Manta to buy what is needed so her customers have everything they need. She has been in the business for 3 years and things are going well for her and she has many clients.

This loan will be used to buy nets, rope, lures, hooks amongst other products. She has been in this communal bank for 3 years and she likes it as she started the business with her first loan. Her dream is to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, rope, lures, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Dyassi

texts.fr: Dyassi vit à Agoè et est âgée de 29 ans. Veuve, Dyassi est mère d’un enfant et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son épanouissement. Dyassi vend des cures dents en se promenant dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Dyassi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un tronc de cure dent, Dyassi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Dyassi lives in Agoè and is 29 years of age. A widow, Dyassi is the mother of one child and works hard to allow her child to thrive.  Dyassi sells wooden toothpicks or tooth brushes by walking around her neighborhood and nearby areas in order to earn income for their subsistence. Dyassi stocks up three times a month at the market. So as to order a trunk of toothpick wood, Dyassi is requesting this loan to make her purchase and thus earn her living.

loans.use: to buy a trunk of toothpick wood

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip is a 40-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Philip has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Philip described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Philip’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. He is 42 years old, is married and has five children.

Peter likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Peter plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Peter’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes and cassava. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet Mary, a smallholder dairy farmer from Shamata village in the Central province of Kenya. Mary's family home is found on her 2.1 acre farm, where she also keeps two cows, 30 heads of poultry and over 100 trees. Mary's main source of income is milk. 

She is seeking a KES 25,000 loan to construct animal housing for her cows. She pushed the budget cost down by choosing to use locally available materials to build the cowshed. She reckons having a cowshed will help her manage her dairy farm better, besides providing her animals with a conducive environment to rest. 

The economic impact of the cowshed will be felt through reduced veterinary cost and increased milk production. Higher income resulting from the investment will help Mary meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit (cowshed)

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives in Getapnya village in the Ararat region with her parents and two sisters. Her sisters are employed in the private sector, and Zhanna, with her parents, runs their family farm. 

In the greenhouse, they cultivate potatoes and greens and gather income from selling the harvest in local markets. 

The greenhouse is old, so Zhanna asks lenders to support her with its partial renovation. She also plans to use the loan in purchasing a polyethylene cover for it, potato seeds and fertilizer for organizing cultivation and gathering more income for the family's living. 

Because this is Zhanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for partial renovation of the greenhouse, a polyethylene cover for it, potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan Camilo es un joven muy organizado tal y como lo podemos ver en la foto, trabaja realizando confecciones a terceros, lo buscan mucho por sus buenos acabados, por el cumplimiento en la entrega y por su organización, él es un hombre casado que trabaja todos los días 8 horas.

Inicio su negocio en el año 2012 y a la fecha cuenta ya con 4 empleados, dentro de sus propósitos es crecer, mudarse a un local más amplio, tener mayor número de maquinaria y estar en la capacidad de abarcar un mayor número de empresas ya que por su excelente trabajo lo recomienda y le resulta buenos contratos.

Juan Camilo solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en el mantenimiento preventivo de su maquinaria y algunos hilos que le hacen falta, de color negro, blanco, que son los que más se usan.

Tú puedes ayudar a este joven que con inteligencia para administrar su negocio ha sabido salir adelante y no quiere detenerse, quiere a afianzar bien su negocio de prestar servicio como tercero y ya más adelante pensar en sacar su línea propia de ropa.
texts.en:
Juan Camilo is a very organized young man, and as we can see in the photo, he works as a tailor for outsourced work. He is sought after for his high quality work, having jobs finished on time, and for his organization. He is married, and works every day for eight hours. 

He started his business in 2012, and now has four employees. His goals include growing the business, moving to a larger space, getting more machines, and having the capacity to serve more businesses, since he is recommended for his excellent work and gets good contracts. 

Juan Camilo is requesting a loan which he will invest in routine maintenance of his machines, and some threads which he needs, in black and white, which are the colors he uses the most. 

You can help this young man who has moved ahead by managing his business intelligently and does not want to slow down. He wants to well support his business offering outsourced tailoring, and later he would like to launch his own line of clothing.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread and perform some routine maintenance on his sewing machines

loans.name: Cristina Bertilde

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Cristina, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, 6 mayores y uno  de 17 años que  estudia en colegio, 4 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Cristina es una gran esposa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza los créditos, el tiene una lancha en el cual se dedica a la pesca, él se desplaza en su lancha a alta mar en las noches y no regresa sino hasta el otro día con el producto de la pesca, luego entrega sus productos  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar para llevarlos a las distintas ciudades para ser comercializados, el trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes han aprendido esta profesión la cual les sirve también para llevar el pan diario a sus hogares.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas y materiales para la pesca además de combustibles para la lancha. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado. Sus sueños son comprar un barco más grande para la pesca.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Urb. Las Viviendas meets every 15 days in Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and work in jobs related to the ocean. 

Cristina lives in this place. She is 56 years old, married and they have seven children - six adults and one 17-year old, who is going to school. Four of them live with her. 

Her husband is a fisherman. Cristina is a great wife, who helps her husband to realize the loan. He has a fishing boat on which he works. At night, he drives his boat out to the open sea and does not come back until the next day with the catch. Then he sells the fish to the merchants who come to this town to take them to the various cities where they are sold. He works with the help of his children, who have learnt this profession, that also brings the daily bread into their homes.

This loan is to buy fishing nets, rope, fish hooks, swivels and fishing equipment, and also fuel for the boat. They have been in the communal bank group for three years and like it because the loans have always helped them. Their dream is to buy a bigger fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fuel, nets, rope, fish hooks, swivels and fishing equipment

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Amélévi est une femme veuve et très entreprenante qui est âgé de 39 ans. Amélévi vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de Kégué. Amélévi a trois enfants et pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle vend de l’huile rouge pour gagner un revenu. Amélévi vend ses produits dans les marchés et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Pour commander des bidons d’huile rouge, Amélévi a besoin de ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et augmenter son bénéfice et assurer les charges de ses enfants
texts.en:
Amélévi is a 39-year-old widow who is very entrepreneurial. She lives with her family in the Kegue neighborhood and has three children.

To support her family's needs and earn a living, she sells red palm oil. She procures the oil twice a month and resells it in the markets. 

Amélévi needs this loan so that she can buy some red palm oil, increase her earnings, and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy four drums of oil

loans.name: Chikamai's Group

texts.en:
Chikamai, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. He is 53 years old, is married and has seven children.

Chikamai likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to save more money. Chikamai plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy more land to cultivate.

In total, Chikamai’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize

loans.name: Odjoti

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Odjoti est une femme veuve et mère de trois enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Odjoti vit à Agoè et vend du charbon du bois dans son quartier pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Odjoti s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois, Odjoti demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver le gain nécessaire afin de soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Odjoti is 50 years old, a widow, and a mother of three children. She lives in Agoe and works selling charcoal in her area to earn a living. 

She procures the charcoal four time a month at a local market. 

Odjoti is asking for this loan so that she can buy sacs of charcoal and earn enough to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 11 sacs of charcoal

loans.name: Moussoulatou

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 47 ans, Moussoulatou est une femme mère de cinq enfants. Moussoulatou habite à Agoè et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier afin de gagner sa rentabilité. Pour arriver à ses fins, Moussoulatou s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander quelques sacs de charbons de bois, de maïs et des tubercules, Moussoulatou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin de soutenir ses enfants dans leur besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
A widow who is 47 years old, Moussoulatou is a mother of five children. She lives in Agoe and sells general food products in her area in order to earn a living. 

To be able to conduct her business, Moussoulatou procures goods three times a month at the local market. 

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy some sacs of charcoal, corn, and tubers and earn an income that will support her children's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy five sacs of charcoal, one sac of corn, and one bunch of tubers

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: A 56 ans, Adjowa est une femme veuve et mère de six enfants. Adjowa vit dans le quartier de Tokoin et est une marchande de charbons de bois à la devanture de sa maison. Adjowa réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local du quartier. Adjowa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois pour gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowa is 56 years old, a widow, and a mother of six children. She lives in the Tokoin neighborhood and works selling charcoal from the front of her house. She earns a good living from this business.

She procures the charcoal twice a month from a local market. She is seeking this loan so that she can buy sacs of charcoal, earn an income, and help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seven sacs of charcoal

loans.name: Massogblin

texts.fr: Massogblin est une femme veuve qui habite dans le quartier de Kégué avec trois enfants. Agée de 46 ans, Massogblin achète des poissons frits qu’elle vend dans son quartier et sa prestation satisfait grandement ses consommateurs. Massogblin achète ses provisions  quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des poissons, Massogblin sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande afin d’avoir plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Massogblin is a 46-year-old widow and lives in the Kegue neighborhood with her three children. She works buying and selling fried fish in her area, and her customers are very satisfied with her service. 

Massogblin procures the fish four times a month at a market. She is seeking this loan to buy more fish and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy one carton of fish

loans.name: Duglas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
EL socio tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la construcción, él  socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA. The bank is located in the Vilcabamba district, in the province of La Convencion, in the department of Cusco. 
The member is 27 years old, and single. He spends his days on construction jobs. He has been at this work for quite some time, which is going well thanks to the effort he dedicates to his work every day. He wants to be able to continue work so he can support his family. 
The member is seeking a loan to buy tools for his work. 
This member is grateful for the loan offered, and he is committed to meeting its requirements.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil and bags of garrie for her shop

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a smallholder mixed farmer from Ngesumin location in the Litein area of Kenya. She owns a small piece of land that she utilizes by keeping dairy cows and growing food crops and fodder. Emily's main income source is milk.

This year, Emily decided to place more focus on crop farming. She is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to grow more crops. The biggest challenge she is facing is lack of adequate capital to grow the business at the pace she envisioned. However, with loan facilities available from Kiva via Juhudi Kilimo, she sees a lot of potential and opportunities to do it big in the future.
 
Your loan will have a great impact on Emily's dairy business because crop farming complements livestock farming very well. Besides, her family will greatly benefit from increased family income.

loans.use: to grow more crops on her farm

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Madame MARIE est la  représentante  du groupe BASNEWENDE. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 11 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Madame vend des fruits et légumes depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de fruit.
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 caisses de banane ; 01 carton de pomme ; 01 sac d’arachide.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Madame Marie is the representative of the group called  Basnewende. She is doing very well. Married, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. All three attend school. 

Marie has been selling fruit and vegetables for three years. She stocks up at the fruit market. 

She wants to buy 2 cases of bananas, one carton of apples, and one sack of peanuts. 

Marie wants to save her profits. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cases of bananas, one carton of apples, and one sack of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Rolin

texts.fr: Rollin a 44 ans. Il est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfants. Il vit seul et gère une petite épicerie chez lui. Grâce a cette activité, il gagne des revenus qui lui permettent de répondre aux besoins quotidiens et de faire un peu d'épargne.
texts.en:
Rolin is 44 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives alone and manages a small grocery store from his home. 

Thanks to this business, he earns enough to meet his everyday needs and to save a little.

loans.use: to double his stock of sugarcane

loans.name: Ginette

texts.fr: Ginette est revendeuse de pois, de riz et de cacahouète. Elle exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. Âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants, son petit commerce l'aide a gagner des revenus pour nourrir sa famille. Elle a besoin d'un microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de riz afin d'éviter une rupture de stock.
texts.en:
Ginette is a retailer of peas, rice, and peanuts. She has been in this business for a dozen years. At age 41, she is a married mother of five, and her small-scale commerce helps her to earn an income for feeding her family. She has need of a micro-loan to purchase sacks of rice in order to avoid running out of inventory. 

f

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 67-year-old, proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Peter has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Peter described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Peter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Iko Group

texts.fr: Afissatou, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait des gâteaux et du jus pour vendre . Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour payer de la farine de blé, de l'huile, du sucre, de la levure pour faire des gâteaux vendre. En plus des gâteaux, elle pourra faire du jus de bissap et du gemgembre pour vendre. A l'issue des ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de s'occuper de ses enfant ses de continuer son commerce.
texts.en:
Afissatou, who is the leader of the group, is married and a mother of three children, who all go to school. This brave woman makes cakes and juice to sell.

She needs this loan to pay for flour, oil, sugar, and baking powder so that she can make the cakes and resell them. 

In addition to cakes, she also makes hibiscus and ginger juice to sell.

Earnings from her sales allow her to take care of her children and to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour to make cakes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell to the customers in the clinic pharmacy

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr: Marie Louise a 40 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle fait de la revente de produits alimentaires. Elle rêve de devenir une grande commerçante dans son quartier, elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Elle va doubler son stock de farine.
texts.en: Marie Louise is 40 years old and a married mother of two. She is retailer of grocery items. She dreams of becoming a major merchant in her district. Marie Louise is looking for a micro-loan to increase her inventory. She is going to double her stock of flour.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's Group is formed by nine farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Jane, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has two children. Jane has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Jane isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Jane will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Jane's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Marie Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette a 58 ans. Elle est divorcée et a un seul enfant. San activité consiste à revendre des produits alimentaires, ce qui lui procure des revenus pour répondre a ses besoins urgents et pour faire un peu d'épargne.
texts.en: Bernadette is 58-years old. She is divorced and has one child. Her business consists of reselling food products, which enables her to earn income that takes care of her urgent needs and that she can save a bit of.

loans.use: to buy bags of peas.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en: Javier is 32 years old. He works as a driver and he has no children for now. Javier also works as a seamster. He makes dusters and he needs a loan to buy industrial machines to increase his production of dusters. Javier has been in this business for 5 years, so he knows what to do. Javier is alone. He doesn't have someone that can help him, so he hopes you can trust him. Javier would like to have his own workshop in the future. As you can see in the picture, he is working in his house and that is not comfortable for him.

loans.use: to buy industrial machines to increase his production of dusters

loans.name: Dolores Maryuri

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores e independientes y dos de 15 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en  colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Dolores es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana se decidió a emprender un negocio,   vende ropa de todo tipo, bisuterías y productos Avon, (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo. Lleva más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que los invierte en la educación de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisuterías, perfumes, cremas, entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Urb. Las Viviendas gets together every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, and the majority of the residents are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks of the sea.

Dolores lives in this place. She is 44 years old, married, and from this relationship has four children, two older and independent, and two that are ages 15 and 5 and study in high school and primary school. Her husband is a driver. 

Dolores is a woman who likes to work to contribute toward the expenses associated with her children’s education and household expenses. Seeing that her husband does not make enough with what he earns, she decided to start a business. She sells clothing of all kinds, costume jewelry, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). Her method of sale is door to door and she also sells from her home when her customers want something. She has worked in this business for over four years, and with it she earns her own money and invests it in her children’s education. 

This loan is to buy clothing, costume jewelry, perfume, cream, among other things that she sells. She has been with the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because thanks to the loans she finances her business. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, costume jewelry, perfume, cream, etc.

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tiene hijos. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María para ayudarle a  su marido a solventar  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes  cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que es allí cuando tienen mucho dinero para comprar, ella les deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le deja muy buenas ganancias.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños y otras prendas. Lleva dos ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su vida y su negocio. Su sueño es tener un hijo.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Credito Urb. Las Viviendas meets every fifteen days in the town of Jaramijo, which is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are very hard-working here, and work in sectors related to the ocean. 
Maria lives here, she is twenty and lives with her common-law husband, she has no children. Her husband is a fisherman. To help her husband with the household expenses Maria runs a business. She sells all types of clothing, selling door-to-door, and she also sells out of her home, where her customers come when they need an item of clothing. She takes the opportunity to maximize sales when the deep-sea fishermen come in to port, since they have a lot of money to spend then, she gives them credit and charges payment every eight days. She has operated this way for two years, and has made very good earnings. 
This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes and other items. She has been in Grupo De Credito for two cycles, and she likes it because with the loans she improves her life and her business. Her dream is to have a child.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes and other clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows to raise and then sell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Habitant un village dont la principale activité est l’embouche, Ibrahima s’active aussi dans cela. Il a débuté en 2008  avec un fond de 100 000F qui lui a permis l’acquisition d’un bœuf à 150 000f dont il a pu donner une avance et redevoir une somme de 50 000f à son vendeur qu’il a fini de rembourser. Depuis lors il a développé son embouche et possède actuellement une vache avec ses deux petits et un bœuf. A partir de 8h, il sort ses bêtes pour les emmener paître dans la nature, rentrées le soir, il leur donne de l’aliment bétail pour renforcer et beaucoup d’eau. Pour l’écoulement ainsi que pour l’achat, il part dans les marchés hebdomadaires ou il peut trouver occasionnellement des bêtes à bon prix.
Ibrahima est mariée et père de famille ; il vit en famille et se partage la dépense quotidienne avec ses frères dans la maison. Il a déjà bénéficié de six crédits à l’IMCEC tous dans le cadre de son embouche. Il rêve d’aménager un grand espace pour augmenter la quantité à élever et pouvoir diversifier aussi.
texts.en: Living in a village where the main business is the fattening of animals, Ibrahima also works in this industry.  He started in 2008 with a fund of 100,000 francs that enabled him to purchase an ox for 150 000 francs by giving an advance and owing a sum of 50,000 francs to the seller that he ultimately repaid. Since then he has grown his business and now owns a cow and her two small calves and an ox.  Starting at 8 am, he goes out with the animals to take them grazing in the fields. They return at night when he gives them animal feed to strengthen them and a lot of water. To sell as well as to purchase, he goes to the weekly markets where he can sometimes find animals for a good price.  Ibrahima is married and father of a family.  He lives with his family and shares the daily expenses with his brothers in the house.  He has already received six loans from IMCEC, all for his animal fattening business. He dreams of moving to a large space to increase the number of animals he can raise and to diversify too.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is married with two children, and both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells cereals at the market . She has been in this business for 21 years, working six days a week and selling on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of groundnuts, peas, soya beans and dried beans. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Madina would like to get a bigger space so as to stock more bags of cereals. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises, and electricity.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts, dried beans, peas and soya beans

loans.name: Anaida

texts.en:
Anaida lives in Sisian town with her husband and 14-year-old daughter. Her only occupation is farming. She cultivates potatoes and grows apple. She earns an income by selling the harvest in the local markets. Anaida asks lenders to support her with purchasing two calves and potato seeds (300 kgs). This will develop her farming business and will give her an opportunity to enlarge her farm.
 
Anaida has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful, she is able to make monthly payments for this loan. Anaida has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and potato seeds (300 kgs)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Sol Maria

texts.es:
Sol es una mujer de 61 años de edad, ya toda una veterano que batallo toda su vida, no tiene pareja ni hijos se rebusca su vida realizando lavadoras domesticas en casas de sus vecinos o alguna persona que la recomiende, aparte de que oferta servicios de lavandería, está actividad la inicio en el año 2005, por necesidad económica y buscando ser su propia jefe.

Aprendió empíricamente, su fortaleza y ánimos de progreso son lo que la mantiene en pie de lucha, a pesar de que no cuenta con capital para expandirse y ejecutar varios planes busca alternativas y formas de lograrlo, por ejemplo acudió a la corporación Interactuar solicitando un préstamo, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de una lavadora y de implementos de aseo como lo son trapeadores, escobas, trapos para sacudir polvo, y algunos líquidos especiales que usa para dejar el espacio que limpie impecable. 

Tu puedes ayudar a esta mujer de 61 años de edad que sueña con mantenerse y llevar la vida tranquila que ha tenido estos últimos años.
texts.en:
Sol is a 61 year old woman, a veteran who has struggled all her life. She does not have a partner or children. She goes through life doing laundry for her neighbors or other people that recommend her. Besides offering laundry services, something she started at the beginning of 2005 for economic reasons, she is looking to be her own boss. She learned by experience, her strength and spirit to advance is what keeps her standing and fighting.  Even though she does not have the resources to expand and carry out her plans, she is looking for alternatives and for ways to achieve them. For example, she went to the Interactuar corporation to request a loan. 

She wants to invest and purchase a washing machine and cleaning tools such as, mops, brooms, dust cloths and various special liquids that she uses to leave the areas she cleans spotless. You can help this 61 year old woman who dreams of supporting herself and continue with the quiet life she has had these last few years.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine which she rents and to also buy mops, brooms, dust cloths and various special liquids (she offers various services)

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush is a mother of two children. Her son serves in the army, and her daughter helps her with farming work. The farm which Sirush runs includes cultivation of garlic and greens, and also 15 apricot trees. 

Sirush works hard to sustain her farming business and make it profitable, so she is able to cover the family's basic needs.  

She has now applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of the land. 

Sirush has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful, she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan. Sirush has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of the land to develop her agribusiness and earn more income for the family

loans.name: Meryem

texts.en:
Meryem is a married mother of three; she has raised her children and they have careers.  She heard about how Maya was giving loans to women who had businesses or who wanted to start home businesses.  She applied and her loan was approved. Now on her third loan, Meryem is contributing to her family’s finances and to the country’s economy by selling knitting, felt bags, and decorative items.  By using these loans to purchase felt, thread, and beads, she has made products and sold them from her home and at a stand.  She is both earning money and making good use of her time.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Meryem evli ve üç çocuk annesi, çocuklarını yetiştirmiş ve meslek sahibi yapmış.  Maya’nın is yapan ya da yapmak isteyen kadınlara kredi verdiğini öğrenmiş.  Talepte bulunmuş, kredisi onaylanmış.  3. kredisini kullanan Meryem örgü örerek, keçeden çanta ve süs eşyası yaparak aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı krediler ile keçe boncuk ip alarak üretim yapıyor, bu ürünleri evde ve tezgâhta satıyor.  Hem para kazanıyor hem de zamanını değerlendiriyor.

loans.use: to buy felt, beads and thread

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's Group is formed by nine farmers in Matete District who are being represented by Esther, the group leader pictured above. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Esther has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Esther isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has noticed that her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Esther will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Esther's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Fevziye

texts.en:
Fevziye is the mother of two children. After her husband passed away, her son opened a corner shop. To contribute to household expenses, Fevziye began selling knit items, jams and tomato/pepper pastes she made at the store.  She occasionally sells these products from stands as well, because this expands her customer base.  With her third loan, Fevziye bought ingredients for the products she produces in bulk.  She wants to sell her products outside the city.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Fevziye Hanım 2 çocuk annesi.  Eşini kaybettikten sonra oğlu küçük bir mahalle bakkalı açmış.  Evin bütçesine katkı sağlamak isteyen Fevziye Hanım bu bakkal da yaptığı örgüleri, reçel ve salçaları da satmaya başlamış.  Bu ürünlerini bazı dönemlerde stantlarda da satarak müşteri çevresini genişletiyor.  Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Fevziye hanım malzeme aldı.  Ürünlerini şehir dışında da satmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Alex's Group

texts.en:
Alex is 28 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has one child and is married. As a group leader, Alex is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Alex's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing two solar lights as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his child to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his child to school.

Alex and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 53-year-old proud mother of 9 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Rose has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Rose described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Rose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gilwell Queens Group

texts.en:
Rosalind is a member of Gilwell Queens Group. She is a single mother with one school-going child. She stays at her late parents’ house with her child in Harare. Rosalind and her other group members joined Thrive in February 2015. They received business advice, which she says was very helpful, and she is grateful for the opportunity that she received to attend these training sessions.
 
Rosalind is a caterer by profession and she is operating a small canteen providing lunch to people working at the nearby clinic and also to people working at the city council offices. Rosalind said that she was facing an increase in demand and was failing to meet this increase in demand because of capital shortages. She has applied for a loan amounting to $300, which she said she wants to use to expand her business to meet the increase in demand. The group members together have applied for a combined loan of $1725.  When asked about her future plans, Rosalind said she has a long-term plan of opening a large restaurant in the Harare CBD.

loans.use: to expand her catering business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 more bags of cement to continue building a house

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 64-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joseph has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joseph described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick's Group is formed by seven farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Patrick, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 42 years old, is married and has four children. Patrick has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Patrick isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2014. Since then, he has noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest. This year, Patrick will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Patrick's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Blessed Hope Group

texts.en:
Our world so full of fast food outlets that everything has become instantaneous and there are fables and rumours of chickens that can take at most two weeks to reach their optimum life expectancy. Now an increasing number of people are said to be allergic and health conscious to the fast food industry and our meat diet is considered the least-healthy way to eat by some professionals. 

A possible solution comes from Emelder, who sells real vegetarian products which are largely soya chunks, glutten and spices of different kinds. Emelder is a member of Blessed Hope has been in business for the past five years. She used her previous loan to buy products that she is now supplying to schools and churches, along with the community service of teaching people cooking lessons before they buy. The challenge that she faces now is that she has no labels and brands, and needs labelsso that she can put her products on shelves of local shops.

Emelder is a married, the mother of three and 44 years old. She express her heartfelt thanks to Thrive for its financial support and training development.

loans.use: to pay for packaging and labelling for her vegetarian products.

loans.name: Olivia's Group

texts.en:
Olivia's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Olivia, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 45 years old, is married and has four children. Olivia has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Olivia isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Olivia will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money.

Using this loan, Olivia's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Natacha

texts.fr: Natacha, 34 ans, est marie et mère de deux enfants. Pour générer des revenus pour répondre aux besoins quotidiens de la famille, elle a ménagé un espace à son domicile pour ouvrir une épicerie. L'épicerie marche très bien. Mais elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter ses stocks.
texts.en: Natacha, aged 34, is a married mother of two. To generate income for meeting the day-to-day needs of the family, she has arranged a space in her home for opening a grocery store, which is going well. But she is looking for a micro-loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Alba Yaneth

texts.es: Alba de 26 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 6 años y un varón de 10 años de edad. Mostrando sus ganas de salir adelante Alba se dedica a la costura elaborando prendas de vestir y remiendos a los vecinos de su localidad y los cantones cercanos, además su esposo se gana la vida como electricista, por lo que se siente muy feliz de recibir su apoyo económico. Siempre pensando en lo mejor para su familia Alba desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda, ya que su servicio sanitario no cuenta con las medidas higiénicas necesarias actualmente y ella teme que cause enfermedades en su familia, es por ello que ha decidido construir una fosa séptica y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
26-year-old Alba is an enterprising woman who lives in her own home with her husband and their two children: a girl of 6 and a young man of 10. 

Demonstrating her will to succeed, Alba makes a living as a seamstress, making items of clothing and patchworks for the people in her neighbourhood and nearby quarters. Her husband earns a living as an electrician, and she is very happy to receive his financial support. 

Always thinking of what is best for her family, Alba wants to build a septic tank for her household. Her sanitary service does not currently have the necessary hygienic measures and she is afraid that this will cause illnesses in her family. This is why she has decided to build a septic tank and to do so she is asking FUSAI for a loan which she will use to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron with which to build it.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron  so she can build a septic tank for her household

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos menores de edad en el distrito de San Felipe, que se encuentra en la provincia de Jaén, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro, con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de sucultivo de maíz, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 32 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic materials. He lives with his wife and his 3 minor children in the district of San Felipe, which is located in the province of Jaén, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

He works in agriculture specifically growing hard yellow corn. He has 20 years experience in the field and good personal and labor references in the district. The loan given him will be used for agricultural work, applying and incorporating Phytosanitary products, fertilizer and to pay for labor to weed his corn crops. This will help him improve the physiological, morphological and production of his crops. Also he will have a good harvest and in the end have better production and a better quality of product. So he will have no problem in selling his product which will generate more income that will allow him to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to do agricultural work, applying Phytosanitary products, fertilizers and labor to weed his corn crops.

loans.name: Gloria Geoconda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12,  y 6 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en  colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Gloria es una  mujer que siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente y trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días a visitar a sus clientes a quienes les  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, para ella esto es una ventaja ya que los visita para cobrar y nuevamente les vende. Lleva más de 2 años dedicada a sus ventas con la cual se gana algo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijas lo cual para ella es lo más importante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas que vende. Lleva 4  ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que  sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The 'Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas' gets together every 15 days in the district of Jaramijo. This area is known for it's beautiful beaches, and the majority of residents here are very hard-working and make a living in occupations related to the sea.

Señora Gloria lives in this area. She is 39 years old, and she is married with 3 children, ages 15,12, and 6. Her children study in high school and elementary school, and her husband makes a living fishing.

Doña Gloria is a woman who has always liked to feel independent and work for the well-being of her family. She makes a living in commerce by selling all types of clothing door-to-door. She visits her customers almost everyday, and she allows them to pay by credit and collects from them every 8 days. This is an advantage for her since when she visits them to collect, she is able to sell to them again. Gloria has more than 2 years experience selling clothes, and she invests the money she earns into the education of her children, which is the most important thing to her.

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other articles of clothing that Gloria sells. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 4 cycles now, and she likes it because of the assistance that the loans provide her. Her dream is that her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Freddy Esteban

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Freddy, tiene 51 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 26 y 17 años de edad, los menores son gemelos y estudian en  colegio. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Freddy  es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza cualquier actividad para darles lo mejor a su familia, el se dedica al comercio,  vende pescado, camarón, conchas y todo tipo de mariscos, trabajan todos los días, en la madrugada el se desplaza hasta la playa cercana  donde les compra a los pescadores cuando llegan  ya que así le sale más barato, luego se desplaza en una bicicleta que él tiene por toda la localidad entregando sus productos a restaurantes y personas de la localidad, el lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas y otros mariscos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para  ir más lejos a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas gets together every 15 days in the district of Jaramijo. This area is known for it's beautiful beaches, and the majority of residents here are very hardworking and make a living in occupations related to the sea.

Don Freddy lives here. He is 51 years old, and he is married with 3 children, ages 26 and 17. The younger ones are twins and they are in high school. His wife is a businesswoman.

Señor Freddy is a very hardworking man who does anything he can to give the best to his family. He makes a living in commerce selling fish, shrimp, shellfish, and all other types of seafood. He works everyday. At dawn, he goes to a nearby beach where he buys from fishermen when they arrive from the sea, because it is cheaper to buy this way. After that, Freddy rides his bike throughout the community delivering his products to restaurants and individuals. He has more than 20 years of experience in this occupation, and it has enabled his family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, and other seafood. He has been in the Grupo De Crédito since it's beginning, and he likes it because the loans enable him to finance his business. His dream is to buy a car to be able to travel to more distant places to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, and other seafood.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Província de Maputo tem 60 anos de idade, casada oficialmente mãe de 7 filhos maiores de idade, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 3 netos que vivem em sua casa.
É negociante a mais de 6 anos de venda de roupa usada no mercado informal vulgo shoprit onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende reabilitar a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, blocos e mais. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar com a reabilitação da sua obra e mobilar a mesma
texts.en:
Maria was born in the Province of Maputo and is 60 years old. She is married and has 7 children who are of age, only one of whom is studying. She is responsible for her 3 grandchildren who live in her house.

Maria has been a trader for 6 years, selling used clothes on the  informal market commonly known as "shoprite" where she makes a sum of money which she uses for household expenses. 
With this loan she plans to restart the building work on her home by purchasing construction material such as sand, cement, bricks and others. This is her 4th loan from Hluvuku.

In future she plans to finish the construction work on her house and furnish it.

loans.use: purchase construction material such as sand, cement, bricks and others.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Here is Eleonora, a farmer from Vaghatin village. For 15 years, Eleonora has been running her family farm with love and pleasure.
 
On the farm, Eleonora keeps a livestock of cows, calves, sheep, piglets, hens, turkeys and colonies of bees. She also cultivates emmer wheat, potatoes and cabbage.
 
Eleonora works really hard to sustain her farm and gather income for her family. She now requests this loan to invest in her farm and develop it further, so it will be ready for the coming agricultural season. Eleonora plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies needed for the development of the farm. Because this is Eleonora's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies needed for the development of her farm

loans.name: Marco Alberto

texts.es:
Marco tiene 25 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad pequeña donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café propios en buen estado, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Marco espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in his own home in the district of Pomahuaca, a small community where the population works in agriculture, business, and raising animals. It is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

He works in agriculture and has his own coffee crop that is in good condition. He has experience in this business and good references from his neighbors. The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop. With this, Marco hopes to offer a better quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married and has three children. When her husband retired and her children went to study outside the city, his pension wasn’t enough to support the family. Ayşe began making and selling jewelry for extra income. She sells the jewelry she makes in tourist areas and the local market.

She used her first loan for capital. With her third loan, as with her second, Ayşe will increase the variety of her products. She wants a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Ayşe Hanım evli ve 3 çocuk annesi. Eşi emekli olunca ve çocukları şehir dışında okumaya başlayınca emekli maaşı evin ve çocukların giderlerine yetmemeye başlamış. Ayşe hanımda ek iş olarak takı yapıp satmaya başlamış. Yaptığı takıları turistik yerlerde ve semt pazarlarında satmaya başlamış. Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Ayşe hanım ilk kredisini sermaye olarak kullandı. 2. ve 3. kredilerini ise ürün çeşidini artırmak için kullandı. Gelecekte çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Priviledge Group

texts.en:
The streets of Harare are filled with hundreds of women from all over the country who come to the city to work as street vendors. Most of them come not because they like the job, but to earn money to feed their families the next day. Their tell different stories of women trying to find a better future for their families. Memory is a street vendor who wakes up before the break of dawn to compete with other women for fresh farm supplies in Mbare, a local vegetable market. She would not have made it in the streets of Harare if it were not for her strong character that she brought with her from her rural home. 

Things have never been easy for Memory. During the day, she has to be brave and face the hot weather of Harare with her child on her back, fight running battles with the council police and endure verbal insults from passers-by, just to make sure she puts food on the table for her two children. When she and her three friends heard about Thrive Microfinance, they set up a group called Privilege and attended training. After receiving a group loan, Memory has been able to buy groceries for resale at her shop, which is located near her home. She has been able to feed her family and pay the rent with her profits. The group hopes that a loan from Kiva will help them to continue managing their businesses profitably, send their children to school, and buy basic food to keep them healthy and alive.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Daughters Of Zion Group

texts.en:
Equipped with an inherited heavy-duty printing machine and enthusiasm, Florence’s dream has been to run her own printing company. In 2012 she discovered that printing is a good project in terms of profitability, so she registered a company with the registrar of companies in Harare. She approached a number of financial institutions to finance her project, but her efforts were all in vain since she had no property to pledge as collateral -- and then she heard of Thrive. Her objective was to help her husband meet the financial needs of the family.

Florence is the treasurer of the Daughters of Zion group based in the Highfield suburb of Harare. She is a married woman with three school-going children, including one orphan she adopted in 2008. The group received business management training, and started saving from Thrive Microfinance before they were granted credit to enable them to effectively run their businesses.

A loan amounting to USD 350 from Kiva will help her to purchase bond paper and ink, and also to do a minor servicing of her printing machine. Florence hopes to continue reinvesting profits so that the business grows into a full printing house in Harare.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink for her printing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for book production

loans.name: Missoule

texts.fr: Missoule a 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d'une petite boutique de produits alimentaires chez elle. C'est grâce aux revenus de cette activité qu'elle a élève ses enfants. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour diversifier son activité. Elle veut jouter des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en: Missoule, aged 58, is a married mother of three. She is the owner of a small store selling groceries in her home. Thanks to the income from this business, she has raised her children. She is looking for a micro-loan to diversify her business. She wants to include cosmetic products.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Schoshy Group

texts.en:
Three years ago, Scholastic, a 56-year-old women, found out that a poultry business was the most viable opportunity for her and would keep her employed. She then constructed a fowl run with a capacity of 1,000 birds and started with a batch of 100. Currently she is able to raise two batches at a time because she has limited capital. She mostly supplies her chickens to caterers in Harare and in her local area. With the proceeds she has managed to educate her four children who are now adults. Her husband is an engineer who has worked in Botswana for the last four years.

Due to a shortage of funds, Scholastic and her peers who had the same vision as she did created a loan group Schoshy to access funds and training from Thrive Microfinance. The training they received opened up their minds, especially on the issue of savings and bookkeeping.
