With this loan Scholastic wants to raise four batches of chickens simultaneously, at an interval of two weeks, so that she supplies a local butchery which is located in the light Industrial area in Harare. She has a contract to supply this facility with 200 birds per month, and is looking forward to finishing building her house in Kuwadzana, where she lives.

loans.use: to increase the size of her poultry business.

loans.name: Done Group

texts.en:
Anna is a member of Done Group. She is a widowed mother staying at her house in Harare with her 5 school-going grandchildren. Anna together with her other group members joined Thrive Microfinance in January 2015. They received business advice, which Anna said was very helpful to them. They are very appreciative of the opportunity they got to receive the training.

Anna has her business of wholesaling fruits such as bananas, apples and oranges to vendors. She operates in Mbare Market, Harare, where she rents a warehouse that she uses to store her fruits before they are sold. She said she restocks these fruits from different parts of the country, but mostly in the Manicaland province. Anna and her other group members have applied for a combined loan of $1,400, and she wants to use her portion of $400 to increase her stock of bananas, since she is failing to meet the demand due to shortage of capital to buy them in large quantities. Anna also outlined that in the future she wants to operate a large warehouse, wholesaling bananas and other fruits, and she also wants to open new branches in other provinces.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her wholesaling business.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Emillienne a 33 ans. Elle a 4 enfants et vit en union libre. Elle vend des produits alimentaires afin de trouver de quoi faire vivre sa famille. Elle a besoin d'un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de riz.
texts.en: Emillienne is 33 years old. She has four children and lives in a common-law marriage. She sells grocery items to make a living and support her family. She has need of a micro-loan to increase her stock of rice.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice

loans.name: Jillot Belilia

texts.fr: Belilia est propriétaire d'une épicerie ou elle vend des produits alimentaires et des boissons gazeuses. Elle est âgée 55 ans, et a près de 30 ans dans cette activité. Mariée, elle un seul fils. Pour continuer a bien faire tourner son épicerie, elle a fait une demande de microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de boissons gazeuses.
texts.en: Belilia is the owner of a grocery store, where she sells supplies and carbonated beverages. She is 55 years old and has been in this business for nearly thirty years. A married woman, she has just one son. To keep doing well in her grocery store, she has asked for a micro-loan to increase her inventory of carbonated drinks.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated drinks

loans.name: Ostanise

texts.fr: Ostanise a 56 ans. Elle est veuve et maman de quatre enfants qui ont tous déjà fonde leur propre famille. Commerçante depuis plus de 30 ans, Ostanise vend des sucreries pour garder son autonomie financière. Elle a besoin d'un microcrédit pour acheter de nouveaux sucreries à peine débarquées sur le marche.
texts.en: Ostanise is 56 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children, who have all started their own families already. A merchant for over thirty years, Ostanise has been selling sweets to stay financially autonomous. She has need of a micro-loan to purchase some new candies just arriving on the market.

loans.use: to purchase candies

loans.name: Grupo Los Saqras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “GRUPO LOS SAQRAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Izkra ella es casada y tiene 32 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de refrescos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ropa.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank “GRUPO LOS SAQRAS”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and region of Cusco as well.

Sra. Izkra is a member, and she is 32 years old and married with 1 son. She works in her business selling clothes. She has 7 years of experience in this occupation and it has gone very well for her. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead through the work she does in her business. She is requesting a loan to buy dress coats, blouses, and pants.

The two smaller photos attached to the group photo were taken after a meeting.

The other members makes a living in businesses including soft-drink sales, clothing sales, a grocery store, and a clothing business.

Sra. Izkra thanks those who are part of her dream through this program, and she promises to fulfill her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy dress coats, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Lidia Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 11  y 5 años que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo tiene una embarcación para pescar.
Doña Lidia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y sentirse independiente se dedica a la venta de zapatos y productos para el hogar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa,  ella sale a recorrer casi  todos los días en sus ratos libres ya que no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, ella aprovecha cuando hay artículos de oferta ya que de esta forma se gana muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, ropa, ollas y varios artículos de los que ella  vende. Lleva 3 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The “Urb. Las Viviendas” communal bank group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo cantón.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Most residents are hard-working and make a living working in jobs related to the sea. In this place lives Lidia, she is 41 years old, married and from this relationship have 4 children. Two are adults and two are 11 and 5 years old and attend school.  Her husband has a fishing boat. Lidia is a housewife and to obtain her own resources and feel independent works selling shoes and other household products. She sells door to door and also from her house. She goes out to sell almost every day during her free time since she does not have a set schedule. She sells on credit and collects the payments every 8 or 15 days.  She takes advantage and buys articles on sale, this way she makes a very good profit.

This loan is to buy shoes, clothes, pots and pans and various articles that she sells. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to have a great store.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, pots and pans, etc.

loans.name: Limata

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 37 ans, Limata est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec ses deux enfants. A la devanture de sa maison, Limata vend du charbon de bois à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Limata s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Limata demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Limata, a 37-year-old widow, lives in Agoè with her two children. In front of her house, she sells charcoal to her customers and makes an income, thanks to this business. To meet the need effectively, Limata gets her supplies twice a month from her suppliers. She is asking for this loan to put in an order for sacks of charcoal and to make more income to advance her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Olivia

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 2 enfants de 23 et de 17 ans, Olivia a 41 ans. Son dernier est lycéen et l'ainée déjà marié. Achat et revente des chaussures neuves et à l'occasion est  l'activité source de revenu d'Olivia. Elle dispose 7 années d'expérience en la matière. Avant, elle s'adonnait à la vente de friperie. 
Elle est appuyée par son mari dans l'exercice de cette activité. Elle envisage de développer l'activité, de diversifier les marchandises ( en modèle et en pointure). Les revenus tirés de cette activité ont permis à la famille de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, la scolarisation des enfants.
Elle veut devenir fournisseur des détaillants à la campagne et les périphériques de la ville.
texts.en:
A married mother of two children, aged 23 and 17, Olivia is 41years old. Her youngest one is a high school student, and the oldest is already married. Buying and selling new and used shoes is Olivia’s business and the source of her income. She has seven years of experience in this area. In the past, she used to devote all her time to selling secondhand clothing. She supports her husband in operating this business. 

Olivia envisions developing the business and diversifying the merchandise (in styles and sizes). The income derived from this business has enabled her to meet family needs and cover the children’s schooling costs. Olivia wants to become a supplier for retailers in the countryside and in outlying areas of town.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Lawalia 02 Group

texts.fr: Mariam, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Elle gère sa boutique et cela fait plus de 20 ans. Mariam a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des marchandises diverses( lait, sucre, les pâtes alimentaires, du savon, de la mayonnaise, du thé, du nescafé,etc) pour sa boutique. Le groupe de Mariam est à son troisième contrat de  prêt avec ACFIME. Il fait les remboursements à la bonne date. Après ses ventes, Mariam aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire les dépenses de ses enfants et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Mariam, a representative member, is a married mother of seven children, not all in school. She has been running her store for twenty years. She has need of this loan to purchase various goods (milk, sugar, pasta, soap, mayonnaise, tea, Nescafé, etc.) for her store. Mariam’s group is on its 3rd loan contract with ACFIME. And it makes payments on time. After making her sales, Mariam will have a profit enabling her to cover her children’s expenses and to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell in her shop
